content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
												I haven't play this game for over a year.Bought it just for multiplayer, which unfortunately is dead and boring. Most people I've seen are 12, 1-2 scatter on official and private servers.I played for 20 hours on an official servers.First I tried a Official story mode server (for about an hour). I found playing on this to be completely pointless. It still setup for single player. Meaning once a mission is completed, it's gone forever. Unfortunately learning new things are completely mission based. So all these type of servers are dependant on how many have come before you and how far they've gotten in the missions. Hence now no one plays anymore on these servers.Per the Dev in the forums, go play on a private server. <-- I had a colorful thought to this remake.Then I tried an official adeventure survival server (pvpve). The game still has lots of bug and glitches. You can't destroy player built structure, and there's lots of them, usually in cities where you need to go for missions in order to be able to advance. Players log on temporarly, build something stupid (grief) and log off. Imagine that, PVP with no raiding allowed. Second I was completely bored. There's nothing to really do except some missions. some are glitch and you'll never be able to complete them, some are just plain stupid, none are level biased. Example. I just created my character (that has no exps or skills), run thru the mission script (that you can't abort), it spawns some monsters that kill me instantly in one hit. You have the option to revive yourself, but there's no point since they are still standing where they killed you. You respawn and die immediately again.On the adventure server I found you get skills. To get a skill to go up, you must get experience points by mining, chopping trees, or fighting. All drops are random. I spent 20 hours to only get the knowledge to make a stone pick (after 4 hours of game play) and a copper shovel (after 17 hrs of game play). I found out I can mine ore with a shovel. A stone pick will not mine ores.If you ask the right NPC, they will give you a mission for a MK2 laser rifle, after that you don't need anything else.Shovels are obsoleted in this game. Best just use a pick, better reward and faster. Shovels only do a wider area, but less reward.Ranged combat is everything in this game, you only use melee when you first start or if you absolutely have to.They've added dungeons (adventure only). Risk vs reward just isn't there. Plus you find no scripts (to learn how to make new items) in dungeons. Just armor and weapons, mostly just junk to sell.Fighting the various monster in the game is uninspiring. They run directly at you and get stuck on whatever obsticle is in the way.  And then there's the part that hardly any spawn all. I remember a year ago, I was being chased alot. Not so anymore. Most just travel in packs. Kill half of them, the rest flee. In dungeons, the harder monsters are just too big and get stuck easily. Making it easy for you to kil lthem. To make money to buy items you have to be able to sell. Most of the time, merchants are out of money, so you can't sell anything. They've added a comfort level to characters in order to punish players that are too active. Now you must either buy a comfort shot or sit in a chair/bed and wait for your comfort level to rise. Yes, this type of innovation really make me want to play this game all the more. Watch tv while waiting for your comfort level to max out, so you can play for a while to do it all over again. And the better the armor, the less comfort maximun you have, so the more you have to eat and rest, but if you eat too much then you also get penalized. So I'm starving, b ut sincve all I had was low value food, I'm also penalized for it, makes sense. Yup, they've taken all the fun right out of game play.Was reading this game is "supposedly" schedule to leave EA on Nov 7 due to external pressure. Yeah, that's a very good reason to move a game out of EA, who cares if it's full of bugs, as long as we make everyone else happy, except the people who play it.On the plus side you can make your own vehicles and weapons. It seems overly complicated to me as I don't play this game much. But if you're into spending hours on something like this, then this game is for you.Got a disease, forget about getting a remedy for it, just teleport to a location to get rid of it. Kinda wondering why they even added them.It can be fun for a while, new game nostalgia, after a while you'll start to lose interest, find out it's just repetative, and finally figure out it's just boring.Disclaimer:I understand that it's still in EA, but so what, you sold it here, you get rated on what it currently is not what you think it will be.Update:Tried the Single player game.No skill advancement in Story mode.This is what this game is truely designed for.However you'll get to a point in the story where you can't proceed anymore. It's a recue mission, a ship trapped up really high between two cliffs.You have two options for the mission: Option 1: Build an aircraft (to reach the survivors), unfortunately you can't do this since you can't build a factory yet to make the neccessay parts for the aircraft. Which leaves Option 2....... Option 2: Build a ramp up to the stuck escape ship. Yeah right. I spent well over 3 hours trying to figure this out. While I'm sure the building part makes perfect sense to the devs, to the casual player it's a nighmare. Not only is building in this game difficult at best, you must build it in the right spot (where ever that is, I tried from multiple angles) and I was unable to rotate it, so you must struggle with that too. I even managed to build a ramp to the ship, however I guess it was in the wrong spot and so it didn't count.  And trying to delete what you just accidently build doesn't always work either. So you must try over and over and over. Eventually I just gave up on building the stupid ramp and on this game. Since this is a main mission, and you can't progress in the story until you complete it.Guess I'll just wait another year again.........Added note: Strange bug that clears out your tool bar randomly.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is crazy fun, even in it's beta stage. The environments are gorgeous (I LOVE the bioluminescent trees and flowers), the light level at night is reasonably realistic (if you don't have light sources on you, it's really hard to see - which is as it should be imo), and the tools you use to modify the world around you work well also - shovels clear more land than picks, but yeild fewer usable resources; and unlike many fantasy games there is a good amount of medeival-style feel that for me, really accents the sci-fi nature of the game *very* well.  Swords and Guns (including Flare and Rope guns) in the same game at base? YES!It's not the kind of game that's going to give you a ton of objectives and tedious grinding to do - there is a bit of that in story mode, but it strikes me more like a long tutorial.  I haven't yet finished Story Mode, though - I spend waaay too much time just exploring the beautiful environment and running the hell away from giant flying stingrays with lazer beams on their frickin' foreheads.The best part, in my opinion, is the ability to start a colony and build it up from scratch, from the buildings to who gets to live there, and gardening/farming in addition to building your own guns and vehicles.  I'm a huge Harvest Moon, Sims and Dwarf Fortress fan, and this game seems to take the things I liked the best about each of those and rolls it into one lovely app. The monsters you fight will even destroy your constructed buildings so you have to be strategic when fighting on your home turf!I like how there isn't any money/gold in the game, either.  The closest thing that passes for currency is the Meat (the same kind you find on animals), and credits you get once you start a colony.The only real gripes I have about this game is the lack of detail on the overworld map (Not so bad in Story Mode, but Adventure and Build modes appear to not have any automated mapping ability, it's just a solid blue background with icons on it.  Though you *can* automatically fast travel to your colony and other landmarks the game creates, but at this time you can't fast travel to map markers you place yourself. The other thing I get a little annoyed by is that the buildings in pre-established villages in Adventure mode can't have objects placed on them unless you've built overtop of a space with the Build tools - for example, if you want to decorate a room on the second floor of the default Hotel building, you have to use the Build tools to overlap the flooring and walls, otherwise your lamps and chairs and stuff will go straight through it.I wish it wasn't such a RAM hog, but it does perform very well aside from that, and the graphics settings actually seem to make a difference.  Very very few crashes.  Overall it's one of my favorites - been following it almost since the beginning, v 0.3x.  It's come a LONG way since then, and the devs are super dedicated.  You can tell this game is a labor of love - it shows!

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is one of a number of surivival games I have in my library, and like most the game is in early access so I find it hard to review it as I know the game is in constant flux.  That being said after a few hours of playing I have to say that Planet Explorers is one of those games that I feel let down with.   I followed from Kickstarter forward and had high hopes for this sandbox.  This has a lot of promiss and isn't a bad game per say.  This is one of those games that I really wish that there were a sliding scale instead of just a yes/no for recommending because I hate saying I don't recommend because unlike TUG I think the game really tries, but the problem is that I think it tries to do too much in some ways.   I think that while it has potential to be a better game in the end than GRAV right now GRAV beats it out.   I have to compare it to GRAV as to me that is the closest match as far as feel.   I will come back in a few months and review however I feel that I have enough time in the game to review and wanted to do so.   So while I am at this time not recommending I am doing so saying that while I am marking as No that I am rating as a 6/10 which is to say that the game is better than it is bad, however if your money is tight you might want to hold off.  However if you are a game collector like me and don't mind picking up EA games and being patient and willing to take a gamble I think maybe in a year or 18 months the game may change my mind.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 19, 2016
												Planet Explorers is a game full of adventure. The game has your basic 3 playable modes: single player, multiplayer and design modes. I been playing the game for several months and followed the updates.  The main story line is a exploration spaceship crash landing on a "unknown" planet. Your quest is to create your own colony while trying to figure out the reason behind the crash. The story line has several hours of different types of quests. Like other games of the genre, the story line will have quests such as protection, escort, and gathering. What really sets a side planet explorers story mode, is the design of the building system in the sense that you as a member of the crew, that is now scattered through out the continent, are in charge of creating you very own colony. The creation of the colony is not a location specific task, meaning that you create it where you want. That freedom is one of my favorite aspects of the game. You can recruit almost all the members of your crew, even make some of them your companions. The colony system will allow you to manage your colony and colonists according to your desire. While not all the materials are produced at the colony, you are able to assign jobs to your colonists. After creating the appropriate machinery they can farm, train or work at a factory. Certain characters will have perks that will boost some of the tasks, combat and healing. The game features a nice menu with easy navigation making it very easy to manage your colony. You have access to this menu from every location but some of the tasks require you to be within the colony e.i. storing or retrieving items. You can even recruit some of the vendors to your colony giving you easy access to some of the prime materials needed to create whatever you want. The other highlight of the game is the creation system. This is a design system where you can design your very own vehicle. The game allows boats, ground and air vehicles. It also allows the creation of robots, tools and weapons. The creation system allows single or passengers vehicles that will increase in fire power, speed and durability depending on the parts added to the design. A lot of components of the game rely on electric charge and will deplete over time. Some of the more complex designs require a lot of work to create all the parts, but they are some shortcuts like purchasing from vendors. I only have played the single player in exploration and story modes. Exploration is a randomly or pre-generated map where you can play with out the basic main story line. AI still offers quests and AI colonies are generated for both friendly and unfriendly races.  I purchased Planet Explorers as a early access. The game is now in V1.0.3. I can say with confidence that Pathea followed through and I am very pleased with the purchase.  If you are unsure about the game please try the demo. It offers around 2 hours of story and it should give you a good idea if the game is for you.

content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have started playing this game 3 times now twice in Alpha stage and now at beta 0.60 while some things have improved other things have gone severely backwards, in my previous two attempts I was able to follow story mode up until the point I reached a city in the game - I wont say to much more than that as to not spoil it for others, now part of that story line has gone completely west stopping the player proceeding to that point, definately a huge step backwards in other respects the game has moved forward in playability but there is not much point if you can not complete more each time a version is released. In addition each time a new version is released you end up having to start from scratch which has become an utter pain in the @ss and the iso system which was initially fun has become dreadfully painfull. default iso's for players who don't want to mess with that sort of stuff but just play the game need to be added - this could be a great fun game if it ever gets finished but it's taking so long that one begins to doubt it ever will be,

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have bought quite a few Early Access games and it is a lot like the stock market, some wins (Kerbal Space program) and some losses (Star Forge). This is a game I had played and enjoyed, but put away for a while to let it mature. While I havent gotten back into it as deeply as my first try, I will say, I am impressed at the changes the developers have made. Early Access Review
								Ive played this way back when it was alpha, it was rather cool and neat with some of the mechanics.But it didnt hold my interest for long as it just seemed like a fancy way to do minecraft.Now that i have returned in its Beta. the game has changed So much! and in a good way.It has a control scheme that makes it stand out to other survival games, and i really enjoy it.i would say its like a MMO cross survival like style.i havent gone through too much in the game but been playing it non stop for the past few days, and i really love the colony system, which i think is only in story mode for now i dont know, but the developers did say about porting Story mode elements into other gamemodes.I would reccommend starting this game through story as its less overwhelming, i like to think that the complex creation system is somewhat optional if your not into it, as there are other gear in game. (just in case you may want to dabble in it later)There are bugs in the game but i trust the developers to get as many worked out in the near future.

content:

Early Access Review
								Best voxel based exploring+survival game so far.Features:-exploration-editor crafting of weapons, vehicles and buildings, therefore almost total freedom in creativity-tower defence-voxel-digging for resources-different biomes with imaginative alien lifeforms-interesting WIP mainstory+tons of sidequests-quickly evolving Multiplayer mode which gets more interesting every update-WIP worldgen (also for MP, which features survival and coop modes)-farming-resource scanning +gathering-run, jump, swim, fly, tunnel, glideCons: (based on current early access version alpha 0.8.3)-player movement feels very stiff.-you can't fly over forests, you need to manouver through trees-Ingame physics weird, causing animals jumping  weirdly far-aircraft controlling is extremely basic-biggest tanks can crash against a tiny sapling-due to WIP, you are currently playing in about 1/4 of the world, confined in invisible walls.

Early Access Review
								I bought StarForge looking for basically an enhanced form of mincraft. It was great let down (granted its getting better) but this game Planet Explorer has far surpassed any expectation I hae had about a craftable game. I am barely into the game and I have already experience a huge variety of monsters, minerals, equipment. I have gotten to build a base with a defensive wall and torrents. The building and crafting system in this game is by far the best I have ever played with, even better then all the mincraft mods. The ability to import an export ISO's you and others have created are an amazing addition to the game as well, which is basically a custom crafted item. I got this on the summer sale but I would pay the full price, it is amazing this is even in alpha as it is so feature rich, I am looking forward to see the finished product. Keep up the great work guys this is amazing!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								After a couple of less-than-stellar experiences with alpha/early-access/kickstarter games, I was pretty much set in the "never again" camp. A friend told me that I _really_ should check out Planet Explorer, given he knew how much I love sandbox games. This game - even at the alpha stage is, to put it mildly, absolutely amazing. Many, many years ago, an essay was written in the MMO community called "Let me bake bread" - in short, it said a _great_ video game lets the player play as _they_ want: Be that fighting, building, exploring, crafting or socializing. This game has it all (well, maybe not quite the socializing, but I haven't played multiplayer). The visuals are beautiful; The build system is limited only by your imagination and the content in the game - again, even at this early stage - reinforces both the suspension of disbelief and wonder.I could not be more pleased with this game. If you are a sandbox game lover, you will not go wrong with Planet Explorer.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is SO much fun. I've been having a blast playing it in both single player (adventure and story mode) and multiplayer with friends over the past week. REALLY glad I bought this- for an alpha version of the game it's surprisingly polished, and so far I haven't found any bugs at all which is amazing. I've beta tested a TON of games over the past 15 years and I'm always finding bugs to report, but so far, I've found nothing. The dev's are really quick to update it too when something breaks, they're really on their game which is a refreshing change from a lot of the 'early access' games on steam that don't see updates for months at a time. One evening, the animation for chopping trees broke. I went to sleep, and it was fixed the next day! I got this on sale, but I dare say, it's worth the full price for how much time and care thats being put into this. It's like Minecraft and Landmark had a baby with the space adventures of Terraria/Starbound thrown into the mix. All my friends who play Minecraft with me love this game to pieces and we've actually been playing this a lot instead! The ONLY thing I would add is that I wish there was more weapon/armor variety IN the game, BUT with the ability to create stuff out of voxels (called/saved as ISO's) you can make or download a TON of fantastic stuff that have been made by users, so it's not even a big issue really. The game doesn't have some decor you want? Build it, or find it on the workshop! Absolutly amazing. And so far, the community has been VERY friendly and helpful- I really hope it stays that way.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								This has to be one of the best games i've played in a while, Although the game is in Alpha stage and some patches fix things and some break things, It has alot of potential to go forward and become an outstanding game.You have a single player mode where you follow the story line and interact with NPC's to perpare yourself for whats to come.You can build weapons from scratch using the build mode, Providing you have the resources and the same for ground and air transport.The game offers,Single player story line, Mining, resource gathering, mob hunting, base building, designing anything from sword to pistols to 4 barrel guns, how ever you want to design them, the more damage the weapon the better. You can also build Cars, helicopters and so on. Disign it how you want it to look. It also has crafting of items that you will need in the game, from spades to mining tools, lights, food and much more.The game also has Multiplayer, which includes all the above with either Co-op or PvP.Work as a team to build a base and defend it from the many mobs in the game or fight your fellow players in PvP destroying there base and taking it to the wire.It has a great community who are willing to help those who need the help and the game has so much more to add.With patches and improvements adding to the game to improve it, and much more to come.I recommend anyone who understands Alpha phase games to join in and get on board to make this the best open world RPG out there, you will have alot of fun. If you like Minecraft and those types of games. There are bugs as there are with many Alpha games, but this is more polished then most i've played of late. Including some currently on steam.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Being as I'm a classic science fiction fan, this game immediately jumped out at me.  Of course, I had to get it and it was money well spent.  It has been a long time since a video game has given me such a sense of wonderment, perhaps not since The Dig, way back in the dark ages.  I found the writing to be well done, with an interesting storyline to go along with the fun of exploring an alien world and designing the vehicles in which you explore.  The designs of the various alien animals remind me of the works of sci-fi and wilderness artist Wayne Barlowe.  I would highly recommend Planet Explorers to any sci-fi gamer.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								One of the best Early Access games I've played to date. There is a lot of content here. Offline the single player has a storyline where you take quests and learn the ins and outs of crafting. There is also an Adventure Mode where the world is procedurally generated and you have to explore and survive with only a handful of NPC villagers.Online works as well. You can play on a server for adventure, versus or just building with unlimited resources.You can also create your own buildings in build mode as well as create custom vehicles and weaponry with their in game creation system. It's quite robust, albeit a bit clunky at first.The game still has a way to go, with some UI and camera issues to iron out as well as more character customization options. Like I said, it's one of the best Early Access games you can play now and with content and updates coming regularly it's must have for anyone who enjoys adventure with mixed with crafting.

Most enjoyable game I have played in a long time. Worth every bit of money I paid for this, and there are not many things in life that you can say that about. Well I off to build a boat and sail into the sunset as boats have now been added too, yaay!!

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								A review yes, because I want all my friends to enjoy and play this! The game has now seen many huge updates and was already a healthy playable game from day one. It has been fun seeing what they are contantly adding because they have listened to the players on this point too.I find myself longing back to this magical experience and will re-start it from the begining as so many changes have been made.You only have to check out any of the developers videos or reviews to understand. I have always wanted a huge alien world to explore with a complete survival experience and thats what you get.This is a wonderful voxel world dripping in atmousphere, were you decide what and were you build your base or camp; inside a huge rock, then digg tunnels maybe wide enough to drive that hoverbike you just designed straight in or maybe a huge base out over the sea?!Want to build a flying craft, you can, want to farm or just trade, you can!They have since added a scanning tool which enables you to see whats under ground; were a type mineral might be and also were there might be a cave.It fast become my fav game of all time last year and has only become better; were you just feels so good being in this beautifully colored world with tough creatures to hunt and riches to digg for. I could go on and on, yet would only amount to spoilers for the game.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								Initially I was unsure about the game. You might be to. The UI is clunky, windows don't stay where you put them, fast travel breaks things, etc etc... welcome to alpha. KEEP GOING ANYWAY. They are making a tremendous effort to voice act the whole game. I found myself actually listening to the quests. I am enjoying a storyline that is becoming increasingly compelling as you not only struggle to rescue stranded colonists but unravel the secrets of this world. It is truely a gem. However in the interest of disclosure I am playing alpha 0.752. So I will list the pros and cons given this version, so that you can decide for yourself if its worth the money.Cons:- Alpha bugs (these will go away but player beware them) Fast travel breaks quests and resets window location. In fact theres a long list of bugs, many specific to a persons game. None of them were game breaking for me personally. Very polished for an alpha imho.-Mining is INCREDIBLY slow. Painfully even if you've ever played minecraft. If you think you are going to change the basic terrain in any meaningful way, you are wrong.-AI is often baffeling. They apear to be nearsighted and terrified of jumping over obsticals. Often I found them on an impossibly vertical surface stuck in place. Time to break out the pickace and carve em off, slowly though, because the pickaxe does nothing quickly. Or just standing around uselessly while I fire away at giant robots getting cut to ribbons by death lasers because they can't see far enough away to be useful. Same goes for turrets, which more often than not get blown up before even firing. Layerback quest is poorly designed as one of the npcs is not invincible and imediately dies unless you bury him in a hole and cover him over. Alpha is alpha.-VTOL (Vertical Take Off and Landing) design has basically nothing to do with reality, and a redesign of the controls for making them in general could use a looksee. You can do it, its just not easy to scale parts, and they don't go bigger than their original size... you'll see what I mean. They fly like they're on rails, and really need tuning up to 'feel' more realistic. See: Battlefield 2142 transport.- Geometry in general. There is no ryhme or reason for running through the base of trees. Accessing the meat from a carcase is an artform not a science. ETC. I'm guessing this is an alpha issue as well but if they don't go back soon and unfrak the situation its going to be a depressing amount of work later for the devs.-Grass... the amount is as staggering as it is GPU shattering. The sensativity of the levels isn't intelligent. Theres basically several options including: none, Too much, holy good god, 1fps, and the all important personal home computer melter level in case ur tired of your pc. I set it at too much. I advise you to do the same, unless you're running a quantum based supercomputer.Pros:-Amzaing story with believable motives, and real characters, which you actually care about because its...-Voice Acted. Hoorah for immersion. Keep it up. Some bits are misssing here, especially when traveling and they randomly talk. I really hope they continue with this effort because everyone who's ever played another MMO has been in a TL;DR accept, kill, turn in kinda mood. This game slows it down, and makes you care, without pulling teeth. Its glorious.-Great Characters. Had to add this on its own. Everyone is believable, at least human-side. Very important to stay away from the classically "I'm evil, because I'm a jerk like that. No reason." *Kicks a puppy*-Build your own: Vehicles ground and air, swords, shields, guns, and more with a voxelbased system that with a little more time and polish will have you wondering: How do I port this to my 3d printer?-Mining, hunting, farming, gathering, crafting, building, sandbox explosion of fun. Some people just wanna horde a million items. Personally I think its a bit in depth, and found myself just buying the finished products... which you can do. So play it how YOU like. Something there for everyone.-Varied quests. Nothing is a grind, everything has a point. None of the go here kill 40 of these because I want their guts for garters crap. If you are gathering, exploring, or killing its for a reason. IE: learning to craft something new, saving a colonist who will sell you some new interesting gear, so on and so forth.-Hang Glider. I know you are wondering, if I've got space copters with lazer beams, why do I need a hang glider? Trust me, once you get this baby and a jetpack, you'll be sold on this game. Soaring through the trees (Which you can't run into don't worry ^.^) you'll notice the terrain is actually quite beautiful.-Fully developed universe. It has history, conflicts, and you get to learn about it all. More than that it effects you, and I found myself going from npc to npc just to find out more about the lore. Tedious reading goodbye. 90% voice acted so the story is 'told' by the characters who its happening to. Immersion is not just important but an expectation these days, and Pathea aims to deliver.-Critters. Mobs. Animals? are varied, interesting, and best of all, capracious. Initially I started with the  run and gun, and getting myself murdered, because they designers clearly favor realism, and I have the suicidal heroistic tendancies of most gamers. Then I found myself cautiously aproaching new life forms. Everything has a power level, and some are over 9000. Descretion is important, almost as much as learning to run like hell. I apreciate this, however some of you would put this in the con group. Some of you can bugger off.Theres more to it, this is a highlights list. I'm telling you I've played enough games to wonder what I'm doing with my life... and I recommend this game, even in its alpha form. Give them your money, and say goodbye to the next week until you come up for air.This is sgmongo, signing off.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								amazing game!!! probably one of the best games i’ve played in a long time, there is so much you can do. its like minecraft and terraria had a baby, then that baby had a baby with pure awesome. the different game modes are great, story mode gives you a good feel for the game and is pretty fun to play through. but what makes this game amazing is the creative side, loads of items to create/ replicate, but the actual creation mode within the game OMG. pretty much think of something you want to make and bam you can do it. want a sick looking car just make it. theres a bit of a learning curve with it but it doesn’t take long to get the hang of. As for it being early access, yeah you can tell in some parts of the game. Some NPC’s will give you the same mission over and over, the game locks up now and again, using ranged weapons with a energy shield on, takes down the shield (not sure if that ones intentional or not haha). Over all for an alpha not really a whole lot wrong with it. Hell its more polished then BF4 was at release. Could not recommend the game more!! if your into adventure/exploration in open world get it, if your into creating/design get it. loads of fun THANK YOU to the devs you guys have done an insane job on the game so far!!! keep up the good work :)

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								One of the best Early Access games I've played to date. There is a lot of content here. Offline the single player has a storyline where you take quests and learn the ins and outs of crafting. There is also an Adventure Mode where the world is procedurally generated and you have to explore and survive with only a handful of NPC villagers.Online works as well. You can play on a server for adventure, versus or just building with unlimited resources.You can also create your own buildings in build mode as well as create custom vehicles and weaponry with their in game creation system. It's quite robust, albeit a bit clunky at first.The game still has a way to go, with some UI and camera issues to iron out as well as more character customization options. Like I said, it's one of the best Early Access games you can play now and with content and updates coming regularly it's must have for anyone who enjoys adventure with mixed with crafting.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								For an alpa level game this is pretty decent. Still needs a lot of polish but there is already a lot of work in this and it shows. The story mode is pretty nice and plays pretty decently with what is there so far. The survival mode isn't bad either but one thing I wish they didn't do for that was give you all the forumlas to craft things with. I like having to hunt and save up to trade with villages and traveling to buy more forumulas would have been nice for survival. Still this is an alpha level game so things can change a lot.I'm thinking you should start out survival (non-story) with just wood level tool crafting known.Update 7/26/2014: After playing a bit more I do have one problem with the adventure/survival mode as it stands right now. You can start out the game and not walk several feet from the village you start in and already there's a large monster (ogre?) with a club or gun mowing you down. This can be solved though by kiting it to the village for the NPCs to beat on. Still it'd be nice to have some breather space when you start out or maybe have a day/night spawn system like Minecraft for hostiles?Some updates went in since the last review as well, the game is getting better slowly so that's good.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								A review yes, because I want all my friends to enjoy and play this! The game has now seen many huge updates and was already a healthy playable game from day one. It has been fun seeing what they are contantly adding because they have listened to the players on this point too.I find myself longing back to this magical experience and will re-start it from the begining as so many changes have been made.You only have to check out any of the developers videos or reviews to understand. I have always wanted a huge alien world to explore with a complete survival experience and thats what you get.This is a wonderful voxel world dripping in atmousphere, were you decide what and were you build your base or camp; inside a huge rock, then digg tunnels maybe wide enough to drive that hoverbike you just designed straight in or maybe a huge base out over the sea?!Want to build a flying craft, you can, want to farm or just trade, you can!They have since added a scanning tool which enables you to see whats under ground; were a type mineral might be and also were there might be a cave.It fast become my fav game of all time last year and has only become better; were you just feels so good being in this beautifully colored world with tough creatures to hunt and riches to digg for. I could go on and on, yet would only amount to spoilers for the game.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers is still in early alpha stages but has promise in the already saturated mining/crafting genre.  The ability to create and distribute ISOs (crafting plans) in game allows for endless building possibilities which makes the game unique.  The physics feels just right, especially when flying.  The jetpack, hanglider combo make exploring fun and the boss fights in multiplayer keeps the online play interesting for a little while.  This game is already pretty fun and will only get better with time.  It is worth exploring this planet!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								At a glance, Planet Explorers feels a lot like another MMO.  This is especially true if you play Adventure mode.  Not being all that into MMOs myself, I was at first a little wary.  Soon enough, however, the lovely scenery, interesting aliens, and a crafting system that has a variety of levels of depth, and I was already humming along and happily harvesting plants.The crafting system is excellent.  There is a basic level, where you learn "scrips" and then build objects out of stuff that is in our inventory.  Then there is a deep level, where you can build any 3D object you want and it becomes available in the game.I also really enjoyed the aliens.  Especially at first, you never know what an alien is going to do till it sees you.  Then you learn really quick.  The scale of aliens is also great.  There are beings tiny like us meek humans, and towering giants that either ignore you, or quickly put you out of your alleged mysery.  This game can only go up as it gets more and more polished.  I'm happy to be in somewhere near the ground floor!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pretty fantastic game with interesting alien plant and animal analogues to Earth. The crafting is extensive but might need to be fine-tuned. You can build everything from a wooden shovel to a helicopter. Just exploring is half the fun but watch out for the other hostile alien race also trying to colonize the planet! Even though it has a lot of fine polishing to be done and it's not very easy to figure out how the crafting system works at first, I highly suggest buying the Early Access, as what I've seen and played shows great promise. You can play a story mode (which isn't finished currently) or an adventure mode that gives you more freedom and more than you'll have at the beginning of the story mode. There are also multiplayer servers where you can play Survival Coop, Survival PVP, or just build in peace. You can play using the seed of Planet Maria or a random seed to test your luck and so you have more control over the environment you'll be "living" on. There's a demo, so it doesn't hurt to at least check it out. 4/5 for me, because while the game is crazy-awesome at the moment, it still needs some polish and it will get that in the months to come.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have had this game for a few days now and I highly reccomend it. IT IS EARLY ACCESS. That seems to need to be emphasized more often these days, but for the money it is a great game!Think of Minecraft with better graphics, with some MMO features thrown in (and more coming!). Throw in some interesting tech and take off! You can design your own vehicles and vtol aircraft!, pick how many seats and such you want, as long as you have the resources in Story Mode, or the Meat(money)/resources in adventure mode, you can let your imagination run rampany on the vehicles. Finding ore (if you dont wanna cheat and look up the grids..until they make minerals random 'REPEAT: EARLY ACCSESS', you have a handy scanner that will read the area around you and you can look for specific minerals. Some aren't listed though, like Tin for instance, but I won't spoil that, if you are having a hard time finding tin and want the spoiler, aside from doing basic googling, you can add me and ill tell you

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Steam is being flooded by sandbox exploration games right now. Next to starbound, this is one of my favorite. It still needs more work, but even in its current state, it is a lot of time sucking fun. What sets this game apart from others of its kind is that it is NOT 2D (its Voxel shaded...i don't really know what that means...) and the construction system. You can actually build cars and motorcycles in the game (as well as aircraft, eventually). You don't just collect the resources and then put it together at a crafting table, however...you use the in-game design tools to design how your vehicle will look, down to the paintjob and decals. My first vehicle was a model-T looking car with a huge turret, and 6 wheels to support all its weight. In addition to the construction system, you also have a massive and interesting environment, populated by a whole host of strange animals...like 6 armed fire-breathing bears. The music is also quite relaxing. There's a story-mode which makes it all the more interesting, as well.

Fewer bugs than some i've seen at freaking launch, an interesting story for single player, and an amazing construction and customization system for weapons, vehicles, and aesthetic items. number of helpful: 22 of 40 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is really rough for how expensive it is. Once you get beyond the nice visuals, you are shocked at how bad it is. Multiplayer is atrocious and not even worth mentioning. Completely broke. Here is a short lisr of complaints in the single player. - Your own turrets target and kill your own followers- Can't take you followers mining, they get stuck in a hole and never get out, end up having to dig a nice smooth ramp up to rescue them.- larger trees have no collision detection, you can walk right into center  and through them completely- No collision detection. While swinging a sword you swing through the mob and end up having to stop and turn around and re-target, because its now behind you. Main attack mode is to swing at air and hope you hit something.- Quest box will not resize to accomidate addl quests- Quest box will not stay in position place indicated, always returns to the default center of screen after any action (ie fast travel)- Quest box will not move to end of screen if you have more than 3 cuurently- NPCS on escort missions are unkillable. Why am I escorting them if they can't be killed?- Hit boxes way to small. Chopping a tree, looting a corpse, picking a flower, all impossible unless you are perfectly positioned, takes multiple positioning attempts  to complete menial tasks like picking herbs.- Beds actually hurt you and not heal, tooltip lies. there is no reason to sleep, except remove darkness.- Food hurts you? Eating food you lose health to regain stamina, you have to eat some food then use a bandage to recoup lost health. - only x and y position mapped, not z, so if I'm underground mining and a monster is on surface, it kills me.- monsters bounce around with no weight to them. I see huge rhinos walking on top of trees effortlessly, consider making larger beasts unable to float.-npcs have blue exclamations over their head and no actual quests for you General - Why is my char able to carry 9999 rock, 9999 stone, 9999 swords, and 9999 suits of armor? Storage is useless since your char can carry every single item in game on them. Nothing in the game has any weight or quantity restriction, besides the 9999 limit- Game is too easy. No penalty for dieing. I can craft 20 revive potions and defeat any monster in game with a wood sword. too be fun it must be a challenge. When I die send me back to a starting point, or penalize me in some way.- Why is ore immediately available for crafting. It should have to be smelted, refined, or processed in some way.-music is annoying, consider more than two 30 seconds tracks on constant loop.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Planet Explorers is a very unique game. While it does come with several short-comings which I will discuss later, the game itself is very well rounded and based on a sound survival tactical idealism that is reminiscient of minecraft, but has dutifully ascended to what Minecraft could never quite achieve; and it's still not complete!Before I dive into what I truly love about Planet Explorers, it would only be fair if I start with a few of it's shortcomings. The first thing is the fact that early game survivability is ridiculously odd, with a botchy combat system and not quite complete progression, this game lacks any motivation to keep on playing past the bad in hopes of reaching something good. Not to mention how ridiculously easy it is to aquire the best gear in the game through the incomplete store function. Sure, while the ability to design your own vehicles and weapons is cool, it's not really something to be all that impressed about, it's very linear about voxel placement and the damage to size ratio is far off to say the least.But putting all of that on the back burner, I would like to now dive in to what I thought was amazing about the game, and the reasons that I kept playing through the faults. The in-game world is beautifully designed, and provides motivation to explore and just admire the scenery. The colony function allows you to find people out in the wildnerness who you can ask to join you and before you know it, you can get a whole group of people following you around. The combat system is great, but part of the problem with it is just how poorly animated it is, but that's very easy to put aside. The animals and aliens in this game are not only well designed, but also are varied in appearance and combat strategy, it will make it difficult to say raid an alien colony without preparation, and it makes your troubles worth it in the end. With a good story mode and great functionality for a game that's still unfinished, it's hard to point out that many faults in it. And even then, to find anything really wrong with the game I had to nitpick.If I was going to rate this game, I'd have to give it at least a 7/10.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								So if you could not tell, it's minecraft on crack, addicting, fun, a small learning curve, took me only 10 minutes to get a full understanding of controls and the build system, be warned though, it is still very much in alpha, and may be there for quite a while, as the AI, enemys, turrents, and even digging are very bad. I seriously doubt this won't be changes in the future, because it is so bad an ally will walk into the wall for an endless amount the time, same with enemys, turrents will shot into the ground if the enemy entired sight than walked into a lower point then is visable to the turrent. One of my biggest problems is the lack of challange of "explore" mode, all crafting items(weapons, armor, so on) is giving to you off the bat, and you simply have to go out and find the mats. The enemys are randomly spawned, so sometimes a huge monster will spawn right outside the base, and the NPCs seem to kill it without taking any damage, OH and when you first spawn in you fall to your death and respawn on the spot I believe they intend for you to spawn, everytime, dont know if that is just me. For myself, I never played this type of game, and minecraft did not interest me past day 1. But I have to say, this game looks pretty good, but I also see it getting boring after story mode ends, hopefully explore mode gets a little harder. In the end I recommend it for all the things they are throwing at you for $25 and what this game will be once it is completed.Edit 1: You can build a wall(you can build these anytime, anywhere BTW) around a monster and then  delete a single stone and shoot it from a safeISH distance away, I would like to see that fixed but I don't really know how that can be with the free build system, I don't know I suppose it is your game and you can play it how you choose. :/Edit 2: Multiplayer and more on explore mode. So I guess they have a "shop" in the right hand corner in both co-op multiplayer and explore where oh most all the items in the game are for sale. In explore mode you start right by a gold mine site every single time, I learnt this well playing legit over and over, and once I found the shop, if you clear that mine of gold out, you can buy yourself anything from the shop. Same with online co-op so it kinda just feels like easy mode. Also there is a quick travel if you did not realize. Open map and left click on a house icon. In the end this game seems kid/noob friendly. There is no difficult part besides walking from point A to point B until you can quick travel there in story, and unless you force yourself to play the hard way you will never die/ lose a fight after the first hour or so. I still recommend it as I am hopeing for a more challenging mode/option to come out, as it stands you can play the game anyway you choice, thus making it difficult, but if you are playing on co-op I doubt anyone else will be doing the same.

content:

Early Access Review
								While this is still an incomplete game, it's very, very nice. Yes, it's an indy game: it doesn't have some of the extreme polish you get in the big company's titles. But it's fun.I'm playing in story mode at the moment, which gives me some building, some adventure, and (you guessed it), the story.Its incompleteness is showing in a few places. For me, the most annoying is with the scanner: it doesn't give a clear indication of where the character is in relation to the minerals you're scanning; nor does it give a clear indication of your facing.I also would prefer a gamma or brightness control (either!) in the video settings.That said, I'm thoroughly enjoying the game. For fans of story-driven games, open world adventure gaming, or colonisation/city building, this is definitely worth a try.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a good game for people interested in a minecraft type of experience. Those looking for a PVP or Hardcore RPG experience will be disappointed. At this point, the game is very limited but don't take this to mean that you can't do anything. The framework is here for a super awesome exploration/building/crafting game. It has an autocad type editor that you can spend hours recreating cars, planes, guns, swords, or decorative items from films, television, and other games. My buddy and I downloaded someone's jurassic park jeep creation and rode around among the giant creatures. It was very cool.SummaryActive Developers with frequent updatesSingle player campaignOpen world exploration with NPC quest giversMining and CraftingRandomly seeded world for multiplayer with co-opMANY, MANY BUGSSLOW Game PlayDifficult multiplayer hosting and connection processMultiplayer works off and onIf you're looking at Planet Explorers wait a little bit before buying the game unless you find it on sale. Development is slow going but consistent. I DO NOT feel cheated by the developer at all. I recommend this game for those interested in it.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								I highly recommend this game to anyone that is into voxel based creative games, action games, and to some extent, survival games.The graphics are quite beautiful, I find myself just stopping to enjoy the view quite often. Textures could be better but the overall asthetic is quite nice.This game uses a smooth voxel system meaning terrain is made up of small voxels as opposed to other blocky voxel games that use large single blox voxels. Just like other voxel based games you can dig and build to your hearts content. One thing tha makes this game really unique is the ability to build your own weapons, shields, buildings, and vehicles using their in-game design software.Want to make Cloud's Buster sword? You can do that. Want to make the Master Sword? You can do that too. You can pretty much design and build anything you can think of so long as you have the materials to build it. In Story and Adventure modes you have to gather materials manually in the game where as in Build Mode you are given pretty much unlimited resources to build with, which from what I remember you can load up your designs from Build Mode into Story and Adventure mode, you will still however need to gather all the proper materials and craft components in the game to build your designs.This is one of the absolute best creative survival games available. I find it far more enjoyable than Minecraft ever was and the devs are adding more and more features.If you are on the fence about this game, do yourself a favor and just jump over to Planet Explorers side. You will not regret it.I give Planet Explorers a solid 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: March 17
												Creative Freedom 9/10Adventure 5/10Sandbox 8/10Survival 2/10Longevity 2/10Because of the nature of this game, I have to review it from 2 angles.Creative/Sandbox/BuilderIn this area the game excells.  There are all kinds of things you can make, a colony of NPCs to manage, and you can even design tools, weapons, and vehicles from scratch.  You can construct your own personal fortress populated with NPCs and defended by an arsenal of turrets.... But, to what end?  Other than being able to admire your creation, it serves little purpose.This leads me to the second angleAdventure/Survival/LongevityThe game is really not much of a challenge.  There are no hordes coming to knock down your door.  Most of the vehicles, turrets, and weapons you make are put to little use (outside of a pvp server).  Feels like you are building up an empire for a war that will never happen.  Playing on a server with the skills system will give you a few more hours of enjoyment, as it will take you longer to get to "end game" gear, but the enviornmental opposition is still lacking.  The quests and dungeons are generic and bland.I still recommend this game, but only if:1) You are looking for a freebuild creative mode sandbox to just build and design to your hearts content.2) or if you have a crew of people to PVP with.

number of helpful: 9 of 15 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Planet explorers is fun. Once you progress a little and are able to make jetpacks and gliders, it gets more fun; the freedom of flying is great. The game initially feels kind of like a cheap chinese knockoff, but as you play you'll be quickly disuaded from that idea (at least the cheap and knockoff parts; the dialogue still makes me think non-native speaker). While you need to mine for resources and are capable of building a variety of structures, terraforming the world is NOT the main focus of this game. Instead you primarily spend your resources building equipment, weaponry, and vehicles. These allow you to fight the hostile forces that reside in the sprawling world as you explore. Both the combat and exploration are really well polished, and those aspects alone are worth the fairly low price. The story has been added to throughout early access, and does a good job of providing distant destinations for you to travel to so that you can lose yourself along the way (not literally; you have a map).

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								First review ever, so sorry if it is not "proper".Now that got this out of the way...Planet explorers feels very nice too me, i don't know something about this game "clicks".Most negative reviews are about bugs and how slow the development progresses, i'll have to disagree with negative reviews on early access for those reasons.I like to give every early access title a chance that it will become a great game even if it takes long, buying an EA game doesn't say somewhere for sure how long it will take for release most of the time.Anyways for planet explorers specifically i look at the development through the years almost since it came out on steam. Although slow, the development progresses steadily and a ton of things have been added to the game. I hope/believe it will turn in a great game!P.S.:Don't dissapoint good (indie) developers with bad/b!tchy reviews/comments and cheer them while they make something that is  for entairtemaint and fun and hope for the best from them!

												This game is a perfect example of how a beautiful game can be marred by poor voice talent. I cannot say anything bad about the rest of the game, it's great and I would recommend for everyone to buy it. A lot of work has gone into it, and it's beautiful.However, the whole experience is marred by unprofessional, unenthusiastic voice talent who sound like they're just reading their lines. It completely breaks the experience of the game. Gerdy sounds like she's someone's mother and has no prior experience in voice acting. Why spend so much effort to make a beautiful game, and then go cheap on the voice actors? It just ruins the experience. I can see it being the one thing that will turn people away from playing this game. I never thought voice was very important, definitely not as important as visuals, but it's really breaking the reality of the game. It's really too bad.

								Pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ amazing, even more so when you remember that's it's an alpha.Graphics are pretty good, I like the style. The music fits in perfectly. I normally don't play this type of games, but Planet Explorers is a damn fine one. As for story, it's nothing exceptional but it does it's job. Group of people crash on a planet they know next to nothing about and, as humanity always does, start to♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and killing anymals, mining ores, cutting trees and harming local ecology in any way they can. Most people give you a little quest, the quests are same as always (fetch something, kill something, craft something etc..) but it works pretty well.It's absolutely amazing how little bugs there are in this Alpha version.All and all, great game, don't miss out!

content:
Posted: November 9, 2016
												I've had this game since 2014, but I haven't been able to play it much due to the sound effects and voice acting being incredibly cringey. I made the incorrect assumption that, when I first heard them, they were just "dev fillers" - developers filling for future voice actors. Boy was I wrong.In 30 years I've never played a game with such demonstrably bad audio. The music is nice, but the voice acting and sound effects are appalling. It's really quite unfortunate, because the rest of the game feels like a lot of work went into it. Performance is good, interface and movement is decent, gameplay and quests are interesting, and there's a lot of depth so far.Here's some examples I've found: Footsteps. Some surfaces don't make any sound. Walking on grass sounds like someone is kicking dirt with each step. Walking on snow sounds like someone banging a wooden spoon against a counter in the distance (wtf?). The footsteps also don't vary much, making them very annoying to listen to after some time. Earth fauna. Several sounds are very clearly from creatures on earth, like eagles, crickets, and other animals. This is especially disconcerting considering the amount of work done to create unique, alien creatures walking around the surface. Jetpack. Very bizzarre here, too. It starts off sounding great, with an "engine fire" kind of sound, and then it devolves into what sounds like a distorted whistle from a teakettle coming to a boil. What? Voice Acting. Whenever an NPC speaks, I'm pulled instantly back into reality that I'm sitting at my computer playing a game. It sounds like the devs chose 10 random people on the street, gave them all $5 USB microphones, then had them record at home. You can easily tell that the voice actors are attempting to do voices that they are incapable of doing. The only voice actor that I've encountered that sounds natural and professional is whomever voices Ava Azniv. That leaves maybe 15 other voices that are terrible. Sometimes the same NPC changes its voice drastically between two sentences, meaning the VO was done separately, with different equipment, and with a different distance from the microphone. 3D sound. The three dimensional sound is based on your character's standing position in 3rd person and not on the player camera, which is opposite of any other game ever made. You ALWAYS play sound relative to the player camera, not to the NPC that the player is controlling in 3rd person. That way the character can shimmy around - strafe, dodge, run, jump, spin around - but the sound from the thing that has the player's attention is static and unmoving while the player camera is looking at it. I've been running forward, looking with the camera to my right, and I'll hear an animal sound to my left. When I spin my camera around to look forward, nothing is there. I need to keep spinning my camera left because the sound came from the NPC's left, not my camera's left.  Randomized animal ambience. Occasionally while playing, a random animal sound will play. Sometimes it's an eagle, sometimes it's a group of crickets that chirp for a few seconds, and sometimes it's a growl from a creature. This is obviously quite disruptive to gameplay since it causes the player to swivel around looking for a nearby predator. But there isn't one. So now I hear a growl and think it's just ambience, but it turns out to be a predator. Ugh.Since like in movies, sound can either make or break the experience, these issues ruin it for me, but I'll keep playing. It's still a well-made game otherwise. I just wouldn't recommend it.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Has something special about it. The art is unique and beautiful, the gameplay is so fun and different every playthrough, which is what I personally love. It's not a perfect game at this stage, but it has the potential to be, and most probably will be in the months/years to come.I can't name all the games, but let's just say this is all your favourite sandbox - open world - survival - builder - simulation games combined into one, with the ability to create anything you like. - Want a custom Gun? You can make it, shape the body how you want. - Need you very own version of the Buster sword, but bigger and badder... maybe in Gold? Sure why not.- Want to create your own Ferrari in the game? Sure you can... it'll take time and patience but the results would be worth it... - How about making your own Houses, with it's own furniture... yeah you guess it, you can make it.Most things like vehicles needs to have some precreated objects (like the engine of a bike) but its up to you to decide where to place the chairs then model and colour the body however you want. Swords require a Hilt object, guns require the handle and trigger object. But the overall shape of it is down to you. Everything else, like furniture or houses... you create them how you want.You will not be disappointed, it's early access and still has plenty of ways to go which only means that the final product will be bigger, badder and awesomer* (if there was ever such a word)

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm going to tell you what you want to know.  *Is this game fun?  Yes, BUT it's still annoying for me to play.  I'm not going to sugar-coat this game, I like the concept, but it's still in Alpha, people, and my impatience+curiousity in the game outweighed that risk factor when I was debating on buying the game.  In the end, I bought the game and here are my thoughts:"It looks like Gary's Mod, Minecraft, Skyrim put into one!"Sort of, if you've ever played Space Engineers, it feels somewhat similar in controls, camera rotating, item building, etc.  I'm not the kind of guy who likes playing games that aren't incredibly fluid in controls, and despite the fact that you can still fix camera sensitivity etc., it still wasn't as fluent after a few minutes into the game.  Also watched a few gameplay vids on this and thought "what the hell, why not steam sale and I want it", but in the end, I didn't really play a lot of it since the gameplay was still somewhat annoying.  Don't get me wrong, it comes with unique features like creating your own sword, being able to weild it, making designs for your own vehicles and guns from smaller pixels and detailing it nicely, but that only got me so far.  So now.. should you get the game?If you have nothing else to buy, go for it. If you're leaning more towards buying this game over something else, don't get this.  Keep in mind that you'll want to put a bit of time into learning and getting used to the controls.This game's controls wasn't as easy to pick up as something like Skyrim, Minecraft, or Gary's Mod. If you have patience, give it a try. If you're like me, don't bother until it's out of Alpha.*edited P.S.I have at least 2 hours of gameplay, but they're not showing. Perhaps I was in offline mode? But I know I spent one night on it going over a number of the game's features in adventure and building mode.Also, don't get me wrong or take this review negatively but I really do like this game.  I like the game and I like the concept of the game, but I hate the controls and the unfluid motions.  It's definitely a recommend for those who have time as people who have made gameplay vids on these look like they're having EXTREME FUN. But I'm not like them, so I'll put this game off for a while and come back to it perhaps when they've added many updates to it? :3

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
Early Access Review
The Short SummaryIf you like open world sanbox games, freedom to build whatever you want and a really pretty looking environment to do it in that is filled with really cool creatures buy this game!The Pros-Amazing object/vehicle creation (see below)-Huge, pretty world-Promising storyline-Stable (I haven't had a single crash)-Nice soundtrackThe Cons-Some sounds/voices missing-Occasional bugs-Occasional graphical glitches-Not all of storyline is finished yet-Fairly steep learning curve (no tutorial yet)My ReviewI had my eye on this game for ages but was undecided - quite often Early Access games can end up being a waste of time and money.  I had previously tried an early alpha demo (available for free from their website but does not do the game justice at all) and was put off by the fact that it seemingly required a click to move the mouse.  Little did I know that pressing F2 enables "shooter mode" and allows the camera to follow the mouse.  Epic.  From the moment I figured that out I was snared.It is fun to play, addictive, pretty and basically everything you want in an open-world RPG sandbox game!One of the biggest selling points is the editor/creator interface - where most games will allow you to make a simple "custom" vehicle out of snap-together parts, this actually allows you to use both simple and complex shapes combined with prefab parts to create vehicles in any shape that you like!  When you have finished designing a vehicle you save it and it gets stored in your in-game library and can be used in any game mode.  You can also share yours and download other people's if you fancy!For me this game was the final nail in minecraft's little square coffin.  For me it was the fabled minecraft killer!  It doesn't have a huge amount in common but the things that it does (admittedly mainly mining...) are done so much better!  Smooth, voxel-based terrain makes for a much more fun digging experience and allows you to be much more creative while building defences and tunnels etc.Long story short, I cannot fault this game in any major way - but I cannot stress this enough, you still have to remember that it is an alpha version!  Although, honestly, I've paid more for mainstream games that felt less finished and polished than this one in it's current state. :)So far of the Early Access and Alpha games I've tried out this is one of the only two that I can honestly say has impressed me to this level.  For me it draws level both in creativity and content to Space Engineers - and that is a serious compliment from me considering that I have clocked up over 230 hours into that came.  It is also clear that the developers really want to create a finished product - they usually release fixes not long after new alpha patches come out and also give a rough idea of what is to be expected in the next release.There are obviously bugs, and certain things could be a little more well explained but honestly this game is worth the tiny amount of time it takes to master the basics!  Features get fixed and new stuff gets added with each update.So enough of this review... I'm off to play Planet Explorers!! ;)

content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								Never before had a game hooked me up so badly, only a week in and spent more than an entire day worth of time on it. o.oAlmost everything in this alpha is awsome! Most stuffs are polished .... let me list out the ups and down for y'all:Alright, for all you skeptic lads out there, I'll start with the down:Down:Bugs (at the state of an Alpha, this is pretty damn small)  - Turret falling through grounds  - Some funky clipping sometimes  - Moster Beacon *** not disappearing or removable.Combat(melee) system could be polished some more ... somewhat stiff.And perhaps some optimization ... might hurt a bit if you do not have a decent PC, my laptop overheated every once in a while ... but perhaps because I might have been playing for too long ;)And now, for the good part ... I could go on with this for hours ... however, here're the highlights:Voxel based construction & destruction (Has according stats, not only for cosmetics)- The crafting (editor) system is brilliant, it is freaking brilliant! you can make your own:   [VEHICLES] cars, bikes, boats, planes, airships, a flying shoe, etc.   [ITEMS] Shields, guns ... you name it. But mind you, all voxel placements and materials EFFECTS THE ITEM'S Stats. (Sadly, you can't make your own ammo yet ... hope it is added though :) )   ["Objects"] Want to make a decoration? Go ahead! Custom fence? Sure! Some dolphin you want to cuddle in game? Go ahead! RPG elements and Colony system:Putting this in the alpha persepective ... the Colony system looks quite promising ... though could use a bit of polishing.- You own a colony, which is used to produce resources/goods and houses Npcs. - Defend it or watch your work go to waste ... the "Colony under attack" Mechanic is brilliant.And the story. I am not sure whether it is completed or not ... But the current storyline I am following is really enjoyable. You start off as an colonist heading from Earth, with Martians ... and was promised a peaceful new start ... and so it begins [Aw Hell naw, I ain't gonna spoil it for you!]Npcs - Could use a wee bit of polishing, many of them are still as dumb as a rock ... but ah well, alpha wise some can talk and all can walk, that's fair.All in all, this is a brilliant game ... if you are looking for something to sink your teeth in, if you like games the allow you to desgin your own ways ... of travelling, fighting, living .... this is totally the game for you! However, mind you ... in order to thrive in this new world ... there are challenges to the mind ... if you think you got what it takes, then hop abroad the ship and off we go!See you soon, and safe space faring Colonists.- spongpol

Early Access Review
								I'll keep it short as it's a game in Early Access, with lots of stuff that has to be done yet.The game shows *a lot* of potential, with MMORPG-like feeling mixed together with third-person shooter and crafting game mechanics. I haven't personally looked much at the building section of the game, which looks absolutely intriguing and fascinating.If you want to compare it to other sandbox games like Minecraft, Terraria or Starbound, the biggest changes are that this set in a huge life-like breathing world rendered in "real" 3D (no more pixel graphics!) that you can modify and make yours to the same degree that the aformentioned titles allow you to.Another big bonus is the fact that there is a single player story mode, something that very few games of this genre offer; however, it definitely feels like a game that is meant to be played cooperatively, so bear this in mind if you want to play in single player only.Trying to wrap it up: if you like crafting/sandboxing games, and if you like exploring vast, fantastic territories... give this game a shot, you'll probably like it.My vote: 7/10 (current game state), 9.5/10 (potential)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								First time doing a serious review of a game, so please bear with me.NOTE: This review is for version A0.82 so my opinion may change for better or worse over time.With that all over with, let's get to the review.Prologue and Creation/building system 9/10Planet explorers is a voxel based open world building/RPG game with Singleplayer/multiplayer support. The game is very playable for an alpha game, and deserves all the credit possible for that feat alone. It's one of the best games I've played this year, and has lots of replay value through the creation system on its own. The building system in this game is one of its strong points. It improves upon something that games like Minecraft fall short on. It gives you the ability to enter a free cam mode and build as you see fit, with support for curved edges, slopes, ramps, and everything else of the sort. The creation system is fun to use, but really flimsy with its actual usage ingame. So far I've seen little use for ground vehicles, aside from being cool looking sometimes. The weapons are terribly weak and could be improved upon. When my 1000 meat pistol does more damage than 20,000 meat tank, then you have a problem. But all that aside, I've spent a majority of my time on this game making vehicles and weapons. It truly gives the power to the players. With admins stating that they plan to add extensive mod support for this game in later builds, I see it having a very long and prosperous life. Instant classic.Combat 5/10The combat system in Planet Explorers is very clumsy to say the least. You lunge forward with melee weapons and flail around like an idiot hoping you hit something, while the massively overpowered giant monsters make scraps of you. I've used 3+ revival shots on fights that should'nt even need healing. The ranged weapons are bearable, but the Ocarina of Time camera angle it throws you into makes moving and shooting very annoying. In the end I found myself relying on grenades and placing down my Artillary cannons to deal with monsters instead of actually fighting them.Exploration 5/10The game is not very rewarding for its exploration, with all of the ore veins being deep underground and very scattered, there's no reason to use your scanner unless you know exactly where the veins are. I havn't played adventure mode much to know about how bad the ore veins are in there, but the ore veins in story are massive and widely spread apart. Its taken my 10+ minutes just to get a petrol vein I needed, and another 20+ minutes to try and make sense of how to dig to it.Mining 7/10 (4/10 without guides.)This is the only game where I've only wanted to get 20 copper out of a vein, but came out with 3000. For some reason the mining in this game is awefully enrapturing. But my poiny from before remains clear, the process of getting to the ore is very agonizing, to say the least. Especially when you're not relying on guides to find the ores. Before I knew they were in set locations, I spent an hour or two on finding a silver deposit.Vehicles 8/10Vehicles are fun, but clumsy. Ground vehicles are like moving bricks, and take damage from everything. Their weapons are extremelly lacking, and eat through what little power they have like nothing. Aircraft are similar with power problems, but by the point you get Aircraft in the story mode you have a means to refuel them. Aircrafts also have much more versatile weapon systems. I cannot give opinions on boats, I've never used them or needed to use them. Sorry.Overall Alpha score: 7/10Presumed Release score: 9/10Personal scoring: 8/10 (Meaning how much I enjoy the game as a whole, not just getting an average.)If you came to this game from Minecraft, you are in the wrong place, this game requires a lot more time and effort to get to a reasonable standing, but is much more rewarding.Sorry if my reviewing skills are undesirable, I just felt the need to review one of my favorite games to date.

The only complaint that I have about this game is that it isn't entirely optimized, but that's something that I can look past because this game allows me to express my full creativity.
