number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								While still in Alpha this game has a lot to offer. Crafting is simple amazing with little limit to what you can make. Design and Build your own aircraft, land rover, house, guns, swords, shields and more keeps being added. By design your own I don't mean you piece it together with prebuilt pieces, like so many other games, I mean completely your own design voxel by voxel. If you want your assault jet to look like a dragon and shoot lasers out of its mouth then go for it. As far as exploring and survival the game thus far offers some interesting enviroments but not much challenge on the survival side. The combat is a bit chunky mimicing something like minecraft but combat improvement is in the works. Story mode is pretty good, it exists for one. Most sandbox games don't even bother but having a story isn't the biggest achievement. The story, thus far, is more engaging then any mmo and half the adventure games out there. It isn't Skyrim quality but its up to snuff. I look forward to additional chapters being added and to see where the story is going to take my character. Overall this is one of few green lite game that are worth buying. There is hours of content avaliable and while updates aren't often they are coming in and I have no doubt the game will be finished as soon as it's ready.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my first "serious" (use that term rather loosely) review of a game that I've heavily started to get invested in....little back story.I've been following this game for awhile behind the scenes and since it was a good deal and I had a bunch of games I recently added to my wishlist within the last 2 days - I went ahead and bought it for something "different." Personally, most sandbox games are damn near zombie heavy and it just ridiculous how the market has been flooded since Walking Dead (nothing bad about the show)...Anyways...Here comes Planet Explorers - which I might add is a VERY interesting take on open sandbox games with a decent story mode.If you are thinking of getting this game, let me cut to the chase and give a good rundown of what I've seen so far:Note: I would HIGHLY advise doing the story mode first and then tinkering with the Multiplayer. Truthfully, the game is fleshing out rather nicely, but the story mode will take you a while to get through and teaches you alot about the limitations as a whole, so you can actually see what alpha is like right now.Ok, so here it goes:PROS------- Game runs superb on a high end system, and no doubt any moderate pc rig should be able to run this with no issues- Story mode is where you want to start at (although the "tutorial" of the story mode is a little odd to catch on and learn the basics.) If you've played any other sandbox MMO then you'll be able to pick up what you need to do pretty quickly. Also, it will take you HOURS, and yes HOURS to play through the story mode if you happen to go off the path and actually have fun exploring and tinkering with stuff as you gain more options throughout the missions.- Obviously, the game is still in alpha, so just be a bit patient as the game gets built up- Creating in the game is a BIG plus. I have yet to do it, but planning on, hopefully, making some fun items for the community. So far, most of the designs I've been seeing are awesome looking and can't wait to try them out after full release.- PE is a beautiful game where you can sit back and relax, watch the sun set on the beach :)- The interface, regardless of mode, is very easy to use-  Using sentry guns to shoot the hell out of rampaging beasts is a sweet :) Think of Aliens the Directors Cut with the senty gun scene, hehe.- You can make scuba diving items to explorer the water!- Found me a loot chest underground with some random items...who knows what you'll find in the most obscure placesCONS (here are some known issues)------- Multiplayer is a little lax since most are probably steering clear an alpha build- Save often in single player. I only had 1 crash from nearly 10 hours of playing. Logs are written for the crash which should be sent to the devs if you like, but for the most part, this game is very stable.- The music can get a little old and hopefully they'll add in different scores to keep it interesting. Aside from that, crank up your own music list and have at it!- There is no tab targetting in the game, so positioning your toon to chop a tree, loot a body takes a little bit to get used too. There is an option to turn on the HP mechanic, for fighting, so you know you are actually hitting the mob, but it would be good to see the name mobs if they choose to do so in an upcoming build. Although, it DOES make it so you have to "explore" and hunt properly in the game (you really never know what you'll come in contact with) - so maybe this isn't such a con, but it's what we all are most used too.- Finding Tin is a PITA! Just make sure you properly use your mobile scanner and it's updated properly. From there, you'll should be able to see a great 360 degree radar view in how close you are to a vein and how far you need to dig to start mining whatever it is you are searching for.Ok, so this is a somewhat look at my experience thus far. I have to honestly say though, that someone who gets bored with games easily - this one is actually pleasant to play. Since it is still in alpha, one can only imagine what else is going to come next with the updates in 2015. I have some high hopes with this game and hope it makes it to be everything everyone wants in an interesting sandbox/massively endless open world mmo.If you are still undecided on this game, definitely keep a watchful eye on it and with any luck, you'll buy it just for what you can do/and hopefully be able to do within the game :)

content:

Early Access Review
								"Planet Explorers" is a voxel based game, often compared to Minecraft or Terarria. However, it is an entirely different game with a different focus and mood. It has an exstensive crafting system where YOU plan EVERY block to your liking, which is a real breath of fresh air and adds some creativity to the mix. Please note this game is early access, so it has flaws. A major flaw is the stiff combat. It is DEFINATELY a work in progress. However, it has the potential to turn in Monster Hunter combat, which if you haven't played is a game about hunting monsters(duh) with very fluid and energetic combat. Although I haven't personally played it much and it is early access, I can definitely reccomend it, at least for now.

								(Early Access Review) Already a really fun game, and will be even better upon release. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								Note: Summary at the bottom of the review.Your colony ship just hit something in orbit, just as you arrived at your destination. Your lifeboat pod has crashed down, and the only other human occupant is injured and need medical attention. You have no weapons, barely any food, and your only tool is a simple knife. Welcome to Planet Explorers.Luckily, the above is not a huge problem, because this game lets you craft all of the above, and not just craft it, you can actually build your own guns and transport, chosing exactly how they should look by adding base parts (a gun has to have at least one muzzle and a grip) and then building the shape of your gun piece by piece from there. This is an Alpha game, and like all games still in early access, that means that things are not optimized. You will experience lag. You will find bugs (both the kind that tries to eat you, and the kind that just annoys you). And the grass...is awful. I recommend turning it off. Look beyond that though, and you find an exellent sandbox game that gives you a lot of freedom as to how you play and what you do. It is, even in its current "rough" state, a better game than many similar games that are considered a finished product. In short, it is a FUN game, that hopefully has a bright future!Pro:*A huge sandbox game with deformable terrain.*A very good (if a bit complex) crafting system.*An interesting setting.Con (these may be fixed before launch):*The grass is simply awful, but can be turned off.*Lag is not uncommon, especially if you've built a lot.*Still needs polish and optimization.Summary:If you are in the market for a 3D survival Sci-Fi Sandbox game, this is a solid choice that shows a lot of promise, even in its current unfinished state. If the developers sticks to it, this could easily become THE survival sandbox game to play. Even "as is" there is a lot to explore and do, and you'll likely have fun doing it! 6/10 -Recommended.For more recomendations and reviews: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/strandedkerbonaut#curation

Early Access Review
								A building game currently under development. Storyline is nice.  Multiplayer needs some help, but it has great potential.I love the fact that you can build your own stuff and use it, i however wish you could take those items before you build them and "try" them for free in a training ground area, something like what Arma did. another thing is that you can build your own stuff but there are so many restrictions to doing so.  for instance, why can't i have a heavy armoured vehicle with 12 wheels? <which would be a tank, "heavy armoured vehicle">  more so why can't i build a gun with more that 3 barrels or one with 2 grips... the creations system leaves alot to be desired.  All that aside, if you love to explore, killing, gathering, and create with only what you have gathered this is your game. Multiplayer requires less of that, more of getting to a minable, profitable, ore quickly without dying with the trader being 'at will' you can sell everything you mine and get all the good gear in no time at all.  the biggest thing i have an issue with on multiplayer is that player to player interactives.  ie.  i can't use ladders from other players, i load under someone's builing after being fast traveled there,  and so on...  There is also no damn clock on the mutiplayer side.  and it seems you get more weather effects during the day time which makes lighting a must.All and all at this moment of the dev. of this game, it still is fun to play and challenging enough to want to keep playing.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12
												I wish there was a "neutral" option but there isn't so I will attempt to remember to update my review If/When new updates come out that change the game.Overall Problems:      * The game plays like it was Very rushed with very little planning or attention to detail.  It has a very complex building system but no explanation as to how to use it, this could be tolerated in an Alpha game, but this should have been fixed before the game left Beta.      * The dialogue by followers is very cheesy and not vey well thought out as is most of the dialogue in the story.      * Folowers don't obey the settings like passive, stay ect. They also can't help you do anything but attack stuff and cut down trees. they do not mine resources or even collect water.      * There are no real directions or explanation of anything in game, you have to fumble through figuring out how building in every mode works and map settings if you are playing adventure mode.        * No tools to collect resources fast, everything is collected by hand, the colony "processor" will collect resources but much slower than you can collect with the lowest level tools.       * Everytime night comes around you get tons of notices that your colonists are too tired to work.        * Your colony Weapons can destroy your own base parts and your own vehicles.       * Colonists don't make their own food, you have to make the food and put it in the storage.       * You have to have all the resources for building in your personal inventory even if you are building with the colony replicator.        * There are still alot of Alpha level bugs.Story mode:      The story is okay, nothing that I would reinstall the game to play again. The conversation text is full of typo's and outright wrong words in places, and the story just ends.Adventure mode:     Adventure mode has several settings, but there is nothing explaining map setup, or tool level progression if you choose that option.  There are also not enough options in world genereation.    If you start with all items scripts already learned and there is no need to interact wil NPC's at all, if you choose to start without all the scrips already learned and you have to do alot of quests to learn to build what you need to start a colony.   Resources in this mode seem to be very deep in the gound with no settings that let you bring them closer to the surface that I was able to find.Multiplayer:        I Played on several servers, the major problem I found was that other players can simply enter build mode and take any materials you place, on one server players just picked up and took all my colony buildings without being part of my colony. ---------------------------------------------------------------------I will recommend this game if you can find the game on sale for $12 usb or less, don't get me wrong, it's an okay game once you figure out how to do everything but I don't think it's worth the $25 usd price they are asking for it.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Currently there are game breaking bugs and you need a pretty beastly machine to even run the game at medium settings.As of now I've played Planet Explorers since it was made available to play off and on. This is my review as of version a0.87.Earlier more stable versions allowed me to play with no problems while runing into rare bugs in story mode. I was also able to play with friends in multiplayer mode with little issues though lack of content made it boring at the time.This latest version seems to have implemented game-breaking story mod bugs as well as many performance decreasing issues that have been left unattended to. It seems Pathea takes a long time to release patches and fix issues. But the patches of content they release are amazing compared to other games, however spread very far apart making the patches not so great.I am currently NOT going to recommend the game at this time as Multiplayer can end up boring and Story Mode (Single Player) seems to have a fair share of issues and game-breaking bugs.

content:
Posted: April 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								Spawned in at a desert, where the starting shops were on an island in the sea. Ran up the ramp to the shops, glitched through the ramp and died of fall damage, first death.Next, a crazy dinosaur creature starts attacking me and friend, almost one hitting us, we run up the ramp to escape, and i glitch through it and die of fall damage again.This time i am careful to jump over the spot where I keep falling, and stand on the edge of the island, watching the beast. It then one hits me from the ground, and i die again.We get wood bows and start attacking it, but it is doing little damage, but it does appear to be dead, my friend thought it was drowned. I hopped down into the sea to investigate. It wasn't dead, just having a mid-fight nap, it one hit me again.10/10 so fun.Jokes aside, this game is genuinely fun. There is a lot of glitches and loopholes which need adressing and obviously that is ok, as it is alpha.Another thing the developers really need to do is to make it so you can really dumb down the graphics. My PC has a terrible graphic cards, and with the settings on fastest very little seemed to actually change and i still had fairly bad lag.Great game in the making though, should buy.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												To whomever cares to read.Got this game more than a year ago, Before ARK and all these survival craziness games popped up. It had a brilliant idea and the gameplay was very good. To create and share ANY ISO (weapon, vehicle, etc) it’s astonishing. It’s a game with mods build into its heart.HOWEVER.... in my opinion. The devs made a big mistake trying to update the Unity (forgot witch number). Game was close to a finish date, and due to this new Coding, the setback was ...Huge...The updates were delayed, because they were working on the core of the game again and the momentum was lost.As it is, the game is very much playable. Not finished, but by far well more polished the ARK and some other survival games. (it’s not a "survival game" apologies for using ARK as example so much)Multi player it’s quite fun, even though some computer savvy might be needed. Simple player it’s very entertaining. If you have the patience to create this game has the tools to make some majestic creations.About the price drop... Inevitable. Like I mention, after years and development and all this new trend to build/survival games, this game needs an active community, creating, trading ISOs to be enjoyable. so better to drop the price and get more people to join then let the game die after finally "finished". Devs kept us updated all the way, and even though i disagree with some decisions made, they were very responding and reliable to finish a game that had great potential and could had been forgotten after their initial success on sales. I recommend this game, and I will keep an eye for future projects.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								To say this game is pretty incredible would be an understatement, but that comes with some major caveats. I am very happy that i paid to support this early access project and i cannot wait for the final product, but i am not sure i am going to allow myself to play further till they expand the content. What I mean by content is not how much the game has to offer but, the way in which the progression takes place. I basically do not want to ruin the experience of this title before it is ready to be enjoyed. While understanding that this game is in alpha right now, in story mode it took less than 3 hours to progress directly from wooden swords to handguns and auto turrets (including processor production for the turrets). This basically meant skipping stone, iron and copper swords/shields/bows varieties, not to mention the countless other recipes that i have completely never had to use. When this game's story mode is quest complete and balanced, i can imagine the necessity of a more balanced progression requiring the use of most recipes encountered. While the game runs pretty reliably, i have had a couple of crashes when switching out of game mode to look up what kind of creature i need to kill to complete a quest. Other bugs seem to be lack of indicating where to click to harvest certain things, text hidden behind mouse cursor, really dumb ai and animals floating in mid air. While the graphics and lighting are stellar the grass textures they are using are animated 2d sprites that rotate normal to the camera, ala trees in mario 64. Pro's: incredible graphicsbeautifully created alien worldfull featured terrain editing/buildinglots and lots and lots and lots of contentCon's:bugs with ai, graphics crashesnot completebalancing issues (too easy)Bottom line this game looks to be a major winner, but i am going to hold out a bit and catch up on some backlog so i can enjoy a more complete experience in a few months.

content:

Early Access Review
								To start off, yes the game is really buggy and DID have slow development. I say DID because they have picked this game back up and sped up the devolopment for than a couple of years ago, but im not saying its fast. they still dwindle a little bit.   Either that or they are working on some huge things. I have really high hopes for this game in general. I believe it has great potentiel Some of the best pros in my opinion of this game is:The voxel creation/customization system.The diversity in the NPCS/Animals.The building and crafting systemVehicles are amazingThe story modeSome of the AI CombatAnimationsExplorationBoss fightingCo-op (kind of, i'll talk about it later)The sandbox. Almost everything is customizable.The open world. This game almost has no limets with that.The NPC trading system.The graphics are really nice to. Still needs a few tweaks but for what it is its good.And it's stability is much greater than what it use to be. The constant crashing made it almost unplayable.Or was it only me that got that? i don't know.Ok i'm to lazy to write out all the cons, because well theres alot. But im going to cover mulitplayer/coopCoop would be really good for this game and its a good game to play with friends, but the coop mode is still in a unstable state. It still works though dont get me wrong, but it can be confusing and i run into alot of problems. This game can be pretty hard going solo and it can go boring after a while to. If i wanted 3 things to be added to Planet Explorers, It would beBetter Coop/multiplayer optimizationMore types of animals/NPCS is always nice, not saying there isen't enough though. Maybe a increase in size for some to? :pAnd maybe better animations, there not the best.:D

content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
												I have been waiting a while to get this game because for a while it was getting many bad reviews. So when it was on sale for 14$ I jumped on the chance to get it. And I haven't been let down. For a matter of fact I haven't been able to play anything else. This game adds many qualities I enjoy from other games into one; Open world,RTS,FPS to name a few I won't lie and say there aren't a few glitchy things but as a early access it is playable. The colony building and the building in general took a bit to get used to but once I did it became crazy fun. Currently playing Story mode and the story, believe it or not, is really engaging. Totally thought it was going to go one way and was taken a different direction. I find myself doing quests more or less just to see what happens next. The crafting system also took a second to get used to. I am used to minecraft and ark type crafting. All in all I say if you enjoy space/futuristic,crafting,building games give this one a chance I don't think you will be disappointed either. Oh and as for the graphics I use a crappy lap top from wal mart on low graphics and it runs fine and the quality isnt bad on fast settings.

Now I have a message or proposotion for Dev/Devs of this wonderfull game, You should turn to your comunity to compleate the character creation process. I have seen some really good ISO'S already and there really are talented people here. Perhaps some one could organize a contest for player models and such. If that goes well perhaps the same could do for in game items.Finally, we need  some dedicated servers to host private games with friends. It will only grow the game.

number of helpful: 14 of 28 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								I played game again, because I recall it's potential. TLDR; wait another year or maybe two.Game has lots of problems. Many are solved over course of development, but there are still so many things are left before it's ready. I can't recommend it now. Wait year or two. I seen many dead early access games to recommend to buy this even with discount.Good things:- story mode is totally playable and enjoyable, quests are much easier to progress, storyline is intriguing, too many will die though;- adventure mode feels really good, rising skills, hunting, fighting, making money, exploring;- editor with templates and community made content is cool, it's easy to figure out things by looking at someone's creations;- game doesn't crash at all (could be subjective as I had my PC upgraded);Bad things:- it needs polishing;- it need bugfixes.I am really up to play adventure mode, probably in multiplayer with friends, but I have too strong beta-tester-feelings when playing it. It's simply not ready yet.Below is my old review, pros are still, cons are partially still true (which is very sad).---I must say it's very pretty and addictive game. But in current state I can't recommend it. It has huge potential, idea with building own colony and surviving is cool. But will it become a good game someday? I don't know.Pros:- huge world, different biomes, fauna and flora;- tier-progressing: wood, stone, etc.- many interesting concepts: items builder, monorail, colony-management;- vehicles!Cons:- nothing (!) in game is polished yet, anything you do will smell alpha-version: digging (animation, sound and what is happening is desync), chopping trees (and looking inside empty model of tree);- crappy UI: HD resolution will blow your eyes, "moving" windows (when you want to drag item), crapy inventory design (tabs in 3 categories);- poor perfomance and high demanding engine (it crashes every hour no matter which settings);- very steer learning curve without much assistance (save-load a lot or dig a lot, up to you);- balance is poor: lack of farming motivation (digging 1000 resources is basically enough until end of game and it take only few minutes to get so much), lack of exploring motivation (you will find nothing interesting);- quests: be ready to stumble or use reload when doing any quest, they are buggy as a hell;- vehicles.

content:
Posted: February 23
												The game is too slow moving and the difficulty ramps up to impossible as soon as you finish the tutorial.  It feels like it needed more time easing the game play loop's difficulty curve.  I baught this to play with a friend and didn't have fun after the first two hours.  I'd avoid this.  This is the type of game you won't know doesn't suit you till the refund timelimit passes.The game has good ideas, but the execution needs refinement.  I'll revisit this later if I hear of any updates that improve things.  There is a good game in here, it just needs to be polished a bit more.Update: 3/31As I said I would, I gave this another try for about another 2 hours.  The lack of instruction on what the options actually mean when creating a multiplayer game was very frustrating.  It was also very frustrating when you would play with the tech tree on and you have no option to filter out things you don't have the skill to craft.  Also, the crafting drop down to let you move to a section, like... armor to helmets, doesn't work.  Typing was also buggy, sometimes it didn't accept me hitting enter or sometimes glitched.We managed to have fun once we turned off the tech tree and figured out that we didn't need to find the nodes in the mineral scanner to find some materials needed for crafting, but it would have been nicer if this was better explained to us instead of us just having to find it out.Still, can't recommend this.  If this were in early access I could forgive a lot of the bugs I and my friend ran into, but you released it, so I can't just give you the "Well... it's in EA" excuse.  There can be fun in this, but the bugs will irritate you.If you can put up with it though, it can be fun, but I'm dissapointed by the number of bugs I had run into that ripped me out of the experience.If my opinion changes as I play it I will update the review once again with more details.

number of helpful: 18 of 37 people (49%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Ill start with what I liked about the game:The single player is fairly fun, it has quests and the like. Crafting system is very basic and the UI is easy to understand. Graphics are nothing to write home about but are okay and playable in my opinion. The custom content creator is VERY cool which you can make custom 3D vehicles and weapons after getting used to it for about 10 minutes. The content you made can be seen in-game right after you make it (after you purchase it and materials). Its also a voxel game which means the mining and everything is in 3D as opposed to minecraft where its all blocks. Combat can also be fun against certain mobs and large boss monsters. The vehicles and equipment can be fun to use like the jetpack + glider.Why I don't recommend it:First of all the game has been in development for about 3 years now and I still feel like its VERY unfinnished. Most of my complaint is the multiplayer. The lobby is REALLY buggy and attempting to connect to friends can be a pain. Me and my friends played it for about 25 or so hours (steam says only 10 because it disables after you close the launcher) and we pretty much did all that you can do in the game and quickly got bored. Building structures is very lame and unrewarding as there is practically no actual use for them other than aesthetics (they also look terrible). It also feels very awkward to build and you don't get much choice in materials and objects to use. The survival element is mostly just fighting off monsters. Which until you can afford to buy weapons, is almost impossible. You also have NO reason to craft items as you can BUY everything via in-game shop which after you just mine random ores and sell it you can buy anything you want fairly quickly, you get end-game content in under an hour if you wanted.I feel like the game is VERY lackluster in content and will only keep you entertained for 30 hours at most before you get bored of it. They say they will release the game sometime in 2014 and if they do at this state then that means this game is a ripoff. There was also plenty of bugs but because it is early access I won't have that as a reason for my unrecommendation.

number of helpful: 9 of 19 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								(version 0.86) So 6 hours of play time and then the game totally stuffs up and I cant load a single saved game.  Hours of fun searching forums for fixes that dont work, and Im forced to start again... FARK!!!!!So far the game looks great, seems like a lot of fun, has potential, but all of that is ruined when the game isnt properly playable.  I know its "early access" but I am SO SICK of that BS excuse devs generally pull out to explain any problems.  You release a game and charge people real money for it, then something basic like loading a saved game fails... leaves a pretty sour taste. (See Update below for possible fix)After 26 hours of play and having (apparently) completed Act 2 of the story, Im about to give up until the next update... I currently cant move anywhere north of the plains zone without the game crashing. Pros:+ Graphics are decent for a voxel game+ Engaging gameplay (think minecraft but more detailed and mature)+ Sounds arent too bad but need refining for distance / ambience effects+ Story campaign is interesting enough so far and a good way to learn the mechanics etc+ Intereting item / building mechancsCons:- Save game issues mentioned (ranted about) above- fairly sparse world - needs more living things- camera needs some work- AI pathfinding needs some improving- Creatures will chase you FOREVER until you kill them or die- Fighting is a little rudimentary- Quest / story bugs...losing track of NPCs etc- MANY random crashes seemingly for no reasonVerdict:Buy it on special and wait until its a bit more ironed out before playing it.  Once the problems are fixed Ill probably change this to a "Yes" reccomendation :)Update:  Turns out the work-around for the save / load issue is to *only* save very far away from where you dig (particularly around the crater), and *not* to dig below sea level... so basically go back to a camp and save there.  Seems to work so far.Note: I am updating this review as I play more...10 Months Later:  Not much has changed.  The game is still half finished and a little broken.  This is why I dont buy Early Access anymore.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is amazing. At first, it just seems like a nice solo survival game, but then it morphs into a game where you're creating your own equipment voxel-by-voxel (you can use others' creations if you don't want to design it yourself), building a colony, and managing a group of survivors. In single player, there's a campaign that is well written and interesting. Just with what's in the game now I can highly recommend it. I've played 80 hours up to this point, and I can easily say it's one of my best Early Access experiences. Development speed is on the slow end of the spectrum, but steady. Each release is sizeable, which makes for an interesting replay. Also, the music is fantastic. Seriously.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								I did not have high hopes for this game at first glance, but I was pleasantly surprised when I gave it a try.  Planet Explorers is a joy to play and you can pretty much build anything you want. I've only played the single player portion of the game and I will be enjoying it for a long time yet to come. Eventually, I will get to multi player and check it out but for now single player is keeping me satisfied.  I highly recommend this game and I hope the devs continue to follow through with its development as I believe this game has massive potential. My recommendation is if you like to build, dream, create and enjoy a good story line you won’t be disappointed if you buy this game.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								As it stands right now, the game is what I'd call early proof-of-concept. It's playable to a degree, but gets old very quickly. The game's UI needs some serious flow tweaks - right now, even with the tutorial system in place, the UI doesn't provide enough information to get a player going. Luckily, you can skip over most of the broken bits. Once you're on the 'planet', there's an handful of quests that you can do, but the flow quickly rears its ugly head and the 'game' is more a set of chores.Perhaps in 5 years time, the game will be closer to what the developer envisioned. As for now, however, it will sit in my game library until it gets beyond a POC.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2016
Early Access Review
-Updated Review-05/10/16EVERYTHING IM REVIEWING HERE IS MY PERSONAL OPINION.So please stay open minded!so as of recently gaining interest in the game once again, i decided to give it another shot!and while the game is fantastic in certian areas it has flaws. some extreme that need addressed and some minior that you can make do with on whatever mode you are playing. first let me just get straight to the point on a issue that needs to be resolved as of now, and il go into the pro's and cons of the game :)The game has moved from a 32bit version to 64bit only version (for now - 32bit will follow but with severly reduced features). the developers are extremely active on the discussions page on steam for the game, so if any questions or concerns with the game that need to be addressed you can post there knowing that a dev will reply in that very day you posted the thread.for anyone interested in the game that has a somewhat mid range PC, Please Be Aware the game is still in beta and optimzation is still a high priority for the devs (judging by comments left on discussions) however.. if you are just slightly above the "Minimal System Requirements" chances are you wont get that great of a gaming experience.the game is primarily GPU intesive and RAM instesive, IMHO the min specs need to be adjusted because a 460 wont even net you a stable 30FPS with the lowest settings (Fastest). im going to give a personal thought on what the min specs should be, just to serve as a guide line for for new purchasers and also to serve as what would be acceptable in terms of FPS!OS: Win 7/ 8 / 8.1/ 10 - 64bitProcessor: Quad Core - i5 2600k or better - 3.2GHz or better Memory: 8+ GB RAM Graphics: GTX 580 or better (dunno about AMD but look up the equivelent)DirectX: Version 10 / 11Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 10+ GB available space (SSD Recommend)Additional Notes: Must have OpenCL compatible CPU or GPU (DX10.1) 32bit can run, but will experience - Extremely bad frame rate / Slow load times for both 32/64bit (devs know about this issue and working on it) and the game has alot of crashes!i say these should be the new min specs because a dual core just simply wont cut it when you get to a certian stage in the game that requires you to make a colony. as soon as you start filling your colony, Your FPS will plummit... HARD! people have said they play fine at 50-60 or even 80-90FPS but when they start filling their colony and hit max population. they say their game hangs around the 18-26FPS / 24-33FPS range!now that the rambling is all done, onto the pro's and consPro's:- Fantastic Huge world to explore (in Single player)- Adventure offers unbound freedom (Randomly generated worlds)- Great World Editor- Amazing creation system (build miscellaneous objects / funriture / guns / cars / planes / heli's / boats / shields etc)- Great in world building - Decent colony managment - Good survival aspectsCons:- Story line is meh (not that appealing)- Voice acting could be better- Some aspects not really that well explained- Clunky camera positioning - very bad mouse options (using anything that requires aiming like bows and guns etc has a crap ton of mouse acceleration, not options displayed in settings)if your PC can handle the game, it serves as a very fun and entertaining game that allows people to build in some ways whatever they like.Total Score:7/10

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Aw yes, Planet Explorers. An excellent game in my most humblest of opinions (I'm probably the most humble guy there is, so I'd trust my judgement if I were you). Invariably fun, fully entertaining, and fully addicting. I've been playing non-stop for the last 127 hours. I haven't eaten, bathed, drank or even got up to use the restroom in all that time. And speaking of not using the restroom; I'm currently selling some quite stained socks if anyone is interested. They uhhh fell in some chocolate pudding... Believe me when I say that 'I definitely didn't defecate into those socks'. Don't ask me why I quoted that statement and I won't tell you how I invented a new type of poopsock, thus avoiding the possibility of breaking my immersion. All jokes aside though - Planet Explorers is a really really great game that is well worth the money. I hope the devs continue their awesome work. I suggest that any who read this should buy it immediately - before the price goes up (not that I know it will, but Early Access games commonly do when fully released). Buy it this very minute or you might be convinced to waste the rest of your holiday cash moneys on some guy's used poopsocks and totally regret it. You just KNOW he's gonna spend it all on new socks. I mean, he can't use the old ones, can he? Well, can he? I'm just asking for a uh friend because 127 hours seems about long enough for dooky squirts to dry. It could create what in scientific communities, is called: 'dooky shards', and they are both painful to be scratched by and will sometimes lead to Sepsis of the feet. Noone wants Septic feet right? Buy Planet Explorers.

Early Access Review
								Boring game. Seems cool from the preview videos but nobody plays it. So if you're the kind of person who finds enjoyment by yourself with some Lego's and your imagination then you'll probably like this game... but the story mode is kind of empty and lacking... and multiplayer had 5 people on the busiest server... all spread out over the map not even interacting with eachother. Games like this need an active world but instead of the game company running the servers and pushing players to populate one server they allow all kind of people to start their own server and if there is any one on it, its usually like one person. If I could get my money back on this game I would. Maybe in the future more people will play it and it will be worth spending money on... but if you're sick of wasting money on games through Steam that you hardly play... then keep moving. This will probably be one of those.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
What I liked: Sanbox to build and craft whatever you want Nice progression of items and techWhat You Need to Know: This game is so unpolished it's like it's still in early access Ok first voice acting is so terrible, why have it if it's bad, just leave it with text only. Trust me it would make the game better Next you have the combat which is so lackluster it makes factorio's combat look amazing. The enemies,some look intersting at first but their animations are lame, attacks are lackluster and overall the combat is floaty and underwhelming. So if your looking for depth in the combat look elswhere.  The first 15 or so hours is fantastic, you get to know the planet, what kills you, new minerals, quest that reward you with new crafting items, and great progression that reminds me of Terraria. After that the quests don't give rewards anymore. This made me not care to progress any further because I seem to have experienced most the game So what is the draw of the game if combat, questing, voice acting and the world get old quick. Well you can design and make your own armor, weapons, and vehicles in their version of of 3D modeling program, (think Besiege but more time comsuming, and you make the whole item from scrath if you want it custom, or just use the templates and modify them) The other draw is building up a base with your own colony with buildings that help you in gathering resources, building complicated crafting items and a place to defend if you want to go all Tower Defense in this game The beginning of the game is so packed with stuff to do, but the late game is filled with so many boring quests it made me quit playing the game, with that said, I will have to not recommend it, even though I enjoyed it for a while I love the factorio style crafting, building your own planes, helicopters and weapons and colony aspect, even though I can't get my self to finish the game right now.My Score:DPrice: 25Main reason for dislike: It's a jack of trades kind of game, lots of mechanics but none are fully polishedGames that it relates to:  Factrio (crafting and colony production) Terraria (Progression early game) Besiege( buidling aspect)

												I have been playing since the game was still barely going through kickstart, so i have way more that the 33 hours. I really enjoy everything it has, at first through all the bugs when i first started playing, there where things like the main story glitching out, but so far, none of that has happened, the game has a slow start, you can just rush through mission and expect to get them all done, you have to slow down a bit and build your first weapons, not the scripts given, like actually create your own weapon, that way they do more damage and makes harder mobs a little bit easier. if you are a creative person, you will love this game, you can design all your stuff that you want to wear, if you want to be a lego man, go crazy, if you want to look like you are from skyrim, sure, why not.If you aren't a creative person, well they have a way you can actually download  other peoples creations [planet-explorers-isos.com]  or  and use them yourself so that you aren't stuck with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ basic weapons and get stuck. The limit on the game is the limit of your imagination. Pros: Havn't found many bugs Always find new 'wow' factors Really cool concept Create everything from Helicopters, to boots you are wearing Multiplayer Always something new to findCons: Sound is buggy, it will sometimes overlay sounds or be very staticy  Gathering resorces is almost a painstaking process, quite slow *its decent if you have your followers helping, or playing  mulitplayer* Creating new things takes awhile if you are trying to be very detailed Sometimes you will be flying through valleys or cliffsides and you companions will try and fight some random mob and get themselves killed

After 3 hours of game play I was able to determine I wouold not be playing aggain. thus, refund, thank you. the controls make this game near unplayable. with gamepad and without. wanna turn the camera? sure, but it is gonna keep turning even after you stop. walking? no, more like sliding. Character constantly feels like they are running on ice. Keeps moving forward even after you. Voice acting is just horrible. Music will drive you insane. and the sound affects......holy hell! this game has an amazing amount of promise. Though the sluggish wonkey controls, unintuitive combat system, all game sounds in general and poor execution hold this game back.visually it is stunning. concept is great. but a game needs far more than pretty graphics and neat concepts to be good. This game should still be in early access beta.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you have patience and don't mind waiting for something that will be special, get this game!  I might just buy it for some of my friends anyways!Random thoughts on the game:Game has tons of potential, the horrendously slow development time has been a pain in the butt, but at least they've not given up on it!Compared to the many other voxel games out there, I feel that this one allows you the most creativity and customization, just on a much smaller scale.  You can import your own textures and decals so that alone gives you nearly unlimited design possibilities.You want to make an exact replica of a WW2 Tommy Gun complete with serial numbers etched into the gun, you can!  You want to make an Apache Longbow on a 1:1 scale?  You can!  You want to make a wooden pirate ship?  You can!Trying to make a solid glass material, I accidentally made a block that changes color with the time of day, I call it a happy accident!Downside, no real flying vehicles, the airships may "fly", but they still handle like a car and can't even go over many trees.  Fortunately the hit boxes for the larger trees are ignored and you can go through them.Quests are a little buggy at times, but I am happy to notice that they are usually fixed as the community points them out and ones that aren't fixxable with a patch usually fix themselves after you save your game and reload it.

content:

Early Access Review

content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Until this game is completly finished, I would not buy it, even if it is on sale. This game has been in Alpha for a solid year and a half and probably will still be early access for another 2 or 3 years based on how slow the devs are working on this game. There are still bugs from day 1 that are in this game, and while it is fun to play for a short amount of time, you will get borded of this game in about a week. This game does have a lot of potential, and I feel if the devs truly buckeled down and finished this game there could be a lot to offer. However right now this is just a shell of a game. There are lots of bugs and this game will crash/freeze alot. I personally feel like this game was a cash grab and it shouldn't have been released until far later. The devs have made many promises with the game but have failed to deliever them after almost 2 years since they opened the game.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								Planet explorers is the best open world sand box game that I have everr played. The combat is excellent with many different types of weapons to use and a wide variety of animals and aliens to hunt and all of them give some type of resource upon killing them, usually meat or some item that can be sold to vendors for currency. The crafting system is excellent and has many armor pieces that can be crafted out of differnt level resources from wood to diamonds. The crafting system also allows you to design and build custom armor, weapons, and aircraft/vehicles/boats all with their own individual stats based on what material you used and how much of that material is in the design. You can also manage a colony and build many useful buildings in the colony such as replicator, training station, repair facilities and more. You can build a tram in the game world and then ride in that tram. There are many quests to do in the story mode. There is a good farming system once you have a colony set up. There is a lot of things to do in this game. I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								Don't waste your money.I bought this about a year ago, it showed a lot of promise. Then there were no updates for a longtime. Excuse is port to unity5. It feels like they've gone completely backwards and are still porting what they had.I'm not a fan in general of early access, and this one hasn't helped. I tried the demo, thought there was enough there to buy, and feel like the second I handed over my money development stopped.New things they are adding I'm not a fan of. The skill system already looks like something that is going to ruin this game (just like 7DaystoDie). I don't understand why every game wants to try to do everything and do it badly. It's not enough to have arbitrary tiers, lets slap arbitrary skill requirements on them, oh and make you research the stuff as well. That is the sure sign of "we've reached the point of we don't have anything left so let's turn it into a long boring grind so you don't realize what a lack of content there really is".So many games right now with so much promise,especially of the "Futuristic Minecraft-type clone with better graphics" (which in and of itself is not a bad thing)  it would be nice to see 1 actually get finished.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have had the game for a pretty long time. I don't play often anymore since they hardly ever update the project. Overall its a fun game, probably one of the most important metrics for sure. However there are a plethora of bugs (game is in alpha after all so a certain number is expected), game performance has been terrible since release in the adventure mode for the game. Story mode while not complete gives you acceptable performance. Probably mainly due to the fact that its a static world and not randomly generated.May want to avoid the games forums (the official ones, not the steam ones) though they are kinda dead, and the few people who are there won't take any critique of their precious game. (thats fanboys for ya, right?)Overall the game showed ALOT of promise when I bought it over a year ago. However since then development has slowed to a crawl (though they did release an update today I see) and it is starting to be outpaced both graphically and innovation wise by newer EA titles like Empyrion: Galactic Survival, Ark: Survival Evolved (even though that one is more mmo) and several other EA survival titles. So in my opinion, skip it for now till they finish intigrating unity 5, and hopefully start putting the pieces back together from the switch over to the new engine. Play one of the other survival games for now. I strongly recommend Empyrion if you want to be able to get off world and have a good quality first person mode.

												First purchased: AMAZING!! support this game! i cant belive its in alpha stage. i have seen "finished" games that were crap compared to this. if i had money to invest i would demand they take my money! im glad i bought this game and look forword to months of fun!After 78 hours of play..Open world, planet exploration, deep crafting system; make amazing things that really work, resource gathering, RPG, sandbox builder. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have about 75 hours total on this game. Many of them were spent playing when i had no internet, so steam didnt record them. This game is, in a word, alright. While the speculated end result of this game is something very appealing, the game right now just isn't that. It has a clunky UI, weird movement mechanics, dumb AI, and lots of bugs. However, it has an interesting story, an awesome creation sharing system, and a truly destructible world, and an advanced vehicle creator, which make for a fun late game. Once you get used to the mechanics and get used to the weird and clunky UI you'll enjoy the time you spend in this game. It sucks that the map is limited right now, but im sure with time it will improve.

								I was a bit apprehensive about buying a game still in alpha development, but its in better shape than many games still in beta. The clincher was that there was a 40% discount and I've been wanting to try a game like this. Its a "start from nothing" sort of game where you begin with minimal equipment and resources and gradually craft better things from gathered materials.In the storyline, you have crashlanded on an alien planets with a few friends to help you survive in a hostile environment. The landscape is fully destructable and there is a mode where you can design your own equipment and buildings.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I recommend this game because its fun to run around, dig, build, create.  One can experiment with architectural design.  That's enough for me to be satisfied but the game as a story has major problems:Be prepared to be frustrated with bugs in the story line.  I've played this game on and off for a while, seen it go through quite a few versions.  On an earlier version I was able to play through story mode pretty far, as far as the developers had written.  My saves were erased with an upgrade and given the amount of time I had spent crafting a delightful and luxurious base, I became discouraged.  I tried to restart, to plod through the storyline with its many fetch-type quests but with another upgrade those saves got erased too.  Recently I came back to the game and have been having fun with it again.  Strangely, though, I cannot get very far in the story quests.  They are extremely buggy.  The story quests appear to have actually become quite a bit MORE buggy since the last time I'd played it.  I can't get past the first quest (a critical character has irretrievably disappeared, and was just reading about the second quest having a high likelihood of a massive game ending type bug also.It is difficult to program games and I respect the hard work.  That being said, I recommend the developers focus on making the core gameplay stable instead of pursuing shiny, new, additional features with each update. I fear/suspect the game has been dropped as a serious development project and that core bugs will not be fixed.  It appears to be used as a template for experimentation instead.  That's cool but It would be nice to be able to actually play it.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								So far I am having a lot of fun with this game. The store page doesn't really do it justice. There are plenty of good reviews out there written far better than I could, but if the idea of a sci-fi version of Minecraft with a lot more depth, better base building, and an awesome system for making your own cars, helicopters, airplanes, swords, guns, base decorations and more I highly suggest looking at video reviews OR... downloading the game demo from the PE Pathea website. Not only that, the game is still being developed.However, the game is not without plenty of bugs being in alpha. Stuff does not always work as you expect. Vehicles may randomly shoot into the air. Framerates can randomly drop or stay very low. The game can crash randomly. You may or may not get an error message. Memory leaks exist. In short, it has issues but has a lot of potentional.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								I honestly want to recommend this game, but I just can't.      Environments become a bit bland after a few minutes, and often fail to load.If you even think about using a jetpack or hang glider for any distance you're doomed, as every time I used them I ended up clipping through the ground and getting trapped below the world.Animations are awkward and combat is just boring.        Now I will admit that the crafting system is fun, being able to dig tunnels and build bases, but the building system is so complecated that by the time you've mastered it you will probably be out of creative energy and just want to play something else.        Basically, if they would clean up the animations, simplify the menu's and building system, and put some serious time into fixing their landscapes, this could be a really fun game, but it is seriously shackled by these shortcomings.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								UPDATE:  Well after 1 year, I am eagerly awaiting full release of PE, and Grav, well, I stopped playing that last year.  Toxic community and not much depth.  PE is still amazing and even better now.I don't know about the other reviews, the game is being very actively developed, just check the log.  There is a new beta release about monthly.   It's also Early access, bugs are to be expected and then you give feedback.  I see so many early access reviews complaining about bugs.    Pretty awesome game and it's still in early access.  I also got Grav around the same time and both games are fun but each is different in big ways.  I had debated on which one to get for a while but in the end I got both thanks to my brother and his generosity. Both game are beautiful with  bright and varied environments.  This will not be a review of Grav, I'll just briefly touch on some of the main differences.Planet Explorers Story mode is the single player mode.  It has NPCs, missions and a story line.  I've only been playing Grav solo because the free weekend seems to have brought some griefers into the multiplayer servers and I wasn't about to deal with that, so I can't speak too much to the public multiplay, though I did set up a server for a friend and me to play.  Grav's single player is more just about exploration, but there are some tasks that you get some rewards for.The story in Planet Explorers is pretty in depth so far.  You'll meet a lot of NPCs, with a lot of missions and rewards.  The biggest difference is with the crafting systems.  Planet Explorers is insanely cool when it comes to this.  In Grav you're working with about 10 resources that you'll need to craft pre-designed items, such as a jetpack or monocycle.  You'll have different workbenches for creating different items.  Planet Explorers has a lot more resources for creating things.  And then you'll create a few things to create bigger things, and then there is a custom editor built into the game for designing weapons, cars, planes, etc...There is no pre-made car, you have to build the wheels, cockpit, engine, fuel cell and then build it and export it into your world.  For example when I had to build a car for a mission, I needed wood and rubber for the wheels, steel, iron and motherboard for the enginer, and to make that motherboard I needed plastic and copper wiring.  This may sound tedious, but it isn't because you can click on a component in the crafting window and it will then open that component so you can click on the ingredients and make them and traverse the heirarchy that way.  It's VERY easy to quickly make components and see which components will create which parts.  You then go into the ISO editor (the name for a custom creation is ISO), which is like a modeler if you're familiar with 3D Modeling.  You'll place the 4 wheels, cockpit, engine, fuelcell and then build your car however you want.  If you google Planet Explorer ISOs you'll find websites devoted to models that you can download and play with.  There are turrets and lots of guns, it's amazing what people have done with this.  Grav has been fun so far, it's a different game.. and Planet Explorers is amazing and fun too.TL;DR: Planet Explorers is amazing because you can create a lot of custom content very easily using many parts and resources.  The story mode is very indepth.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought this game 6 months ago (pre-steam) thinking it would be an amazing upgrade from minecraft. Graphically it is, but when you get down to it. The controls are so bad. I don't know why a traditional WASD control system couldn't be used. It makes combat agains basic monsters so difficult expect to die after any encoutner The custom design feature is pretty cool with one exception, there in no comprehensible tutorial included in the game. You basically have to know how to use auto-cat programs already or find a youtuber that explains the process well enough. While Minecraft resource gathering is tideous, but in this game you literally have no way of knowing if you are gathering the right plant until seeing it for the 20th time and i hope you find it again. Wanna dig a giant hole in the ground? COOL! Just make sure you have a way out, because the caves in this game give you no hope for survival.If you are trying to build a fort to protect from a monster onslaught good luck because those guys can pretty much fly. If a herd wants you dead, your chance of escape is like 20% tops.Overall this game tries to take a game like Minecraft and add elements of modern gaming, however it lacks in the simplicity that minecraft was able to hand out on a silver platter, and it was done with no instructions.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Brilliant game.  If you like open world sandbox with plenty to do to make real progress then this is for you.  The world is fantastic with a variety of environments to explore and monsters to kill.  You can carry an enormous amount of material so you do not have to spend your time running back to base to unload, the crafting system is easy and once you have set up your own colony you can design and build anything from motor bikes, planes, helicopters, vehicles, ships and weapons.The only downside is that the game does crash occasionally and a few of the missions require a bit of help from others but the community is active and helpful.This is a terrific game and although I have only played story mode I am thoroughly impressed and give it a score of 99%.  Well done Devs :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								+++Developers seem genuinely interested in this game, despite some misfortune+++One of the sandbox with most freedom out there. Instead of downloading mods to get that decorative item you want, it's pretty straightforward to build it yourself with the in game creator. The complexity of the things you can build is pretty big.+++Brings something new to the table of the sandbox genre+++There is a story and a purpose!++The game is thought out and presents a meaningful and fair challenge.++Supports and encourages the modding community+Effort was put into graphics and animations and they look very good.-There are a few bugs-- game development is pretty slow (at least lately)---Some quests are boring and meaningless. The usual MMORPG quests, fedex quests, kill x enemies quests, escort quests.-A part of the community simply cannot hear any form of criticism. Make a suggestion at your own peril.-Needs a more explanatory tutorial. Took me a while to grasp the full potential of the crafting UI.-Combat needs more fluidity Worth the 23 Euros it's at. There's enough content to justify an non sale buy.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								Yeah I'll recommend the game, but it has many flaws that need to be worked out (like the fish, you can look at my screenshots and find one of a massive fish that is just out of the water stareing into my soul with eyes like headlights). It is loaded with cool and interesting things and even has some of my favorite things for a game to have. Like the giant monsters and the creation system, but the whole thing has such a steap learning curve it took me the best of 1 hour to make a crappy looking gun. The UI is weird and wonky at alot of points, but it works. The wildlife is extensive and is filled to the brim with wonderous creatures, but if they weren't as insanly hard to kill in story mode it would be better. EX: At one point for one of the objectives I had to investagate ruins of a past race, but massive bird creatures had taken a liking to the place and the would agro if I approched. So i took up archery and tried long range combat the started chasing me and they did massive damage so I died at least 20 times before I was able to cheese them to death. Also their are game breaking glitches like one I experianced I had to follow a character to a little pond area and their were enemys their and for some reason after I killed them he walked to his spot or close to it at least and he stopped moving. The quest never updated and he never did anything either. THIS HAPPENED EVERY TIME I TRYED TO REVERT TO A SAVE. So I had to restart but I mean the game is still in development I can't bash it to hard. The build mode is great but no ceatures spawn but you so its kind of boring. As far as I know you can't put a build world into an adventure mode so it spawns things but it would be awsome if you could this would be a great sandbox game. Kind of like minecraft but more my style of minecraft no creepers just giant murderous desert titans or robots or what ever they are I don't care the are cool as hell.I saw this game on green light years ago and downloaded the free version and oh my god so many glitches ranging from spawning in the sky and falling to your death to walking strait and then *Poof*AAAAAAHHHHHHHHH! right on down to the bottom of the universe it's self. So be thankfull that doesn't happen as much any more. So all its an ok game one to try out for a wile test out everything and see if you like it. Get the game on sale I bought it for full price, I dont really care but its not really worth $20 yet so wait for the full game and then make a full desision. Also please take liberties on the grammer I'm super tired.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Planet Explorers is a fun survival, rpg, build, managment and fight game.PE got a lot of genres mixed in and gives the player the choice of how he wants to play. You can play the singeplayer story, what can take a lot of time, play the sandbox or build mode or try out the advanture mode even with friends (but be sure that your hard drive got enough free space).If you like to explore big worlds, build stuff (weapons, armors, vehicles, buldings and if you like even a WC) fight monsters like the teenage mutant ninj... no not ninja... but mutatet fur sure.... turtles... this game could be for you but expect that this game would need more ressources thant you would belive.Pros:you can dig holes.... almost everywhere!able to build your own stuff (design it in the creator, you could even make you a "steve costum"!Abillity to have your very own colony and trains! (i love trains!)I mentitioned that you can build vehicles, but did i told ya that you can build helicopters, cars, ships and submarins!fighting creatures tha remind you of dinosaurs, godzilla and dragons (well i would say its a mix of a dragon and a chicken...)very big worldsSup. Team (and devs) respond quite fast and they care 'bout the gameCons:Big worlds need a lot of space! (and i mean a lot... like something around multiple 100 gigs)performance issues with big colonies AI companions that like to scare the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of you (just spawning right in front of your face!)graphics aren't that good, so if you someone who needs perfect visuals i'm sad to inform you that this game can't do you right, don't get my wrong, its beautiful (this is only a - if you are fixated on high end graphics)The creator alows much freedome but sometimes just turns you crazy (the recoloring is a real hassle)All in all, i would recomand this game if the pros are your thing.PS: i'm sorry for every spelling and gramatical error in my review

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've bought and played many a sandbox game, this one is by far my favorite.  Crafting, check, world modding, check, the ability to craft as many varied vehicles, weapons, tools etc, check!  The amount of hours ive played isnt showing up because i was unplugged for a month, i must have clocked in over 200hrs to date on this, and its still in alpha phase!!!  I've never regretted buying alpha, but with Planet Explorers, it already feels like a complete game, and just keeps getting better!  Kudos to the creators of PE! es, its an ambitious project, but so far its all been well implemented.  I highly recommend this game to fans of Minecraft/sandbox type games, and just buy the game already, build a VTOL, motorcycle etc, and tinker away!!

								While still in Alpha, the building tools are VERY fun! number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has already been worth the purchase price for me.  I have logged many hours (though like all my steam games most is probably while afk at start screen) and plan on many more.   I love the freedom that sandbox offers and all the creative things that can be done in the build mode.  Creating and then driving various vehicles was also a major bonus.  There are some other features right now and more to come that are very enjoyable like the colony.  I always get lonely at some point in games where there is only 1 character (LOVE 7dtd but still waiting for friendlies in sp mode) but this game doesn't have that problem.  You can setup, recruit then go do whatever and stop by when wanting some company, or bring a couple along.  Or go it alone and leave the others to their fate as you attempt to survive the wilds using what you can find, or mooch off them.   The options are available which is great so you don't feel pigeonholed.  This is your new world essentially so do what you can/will.  There are some downsides as it is in ALPHA like mentioned in the store.  The game is a memory hog and needs to be optimized, there are some glitches with loading npc's and sometimes turrets but that will come with time.  All in all I would recommend for anyone that enjoys sandbox, building and space games.  This is from memory so not extremely detailed but something I found useful is to build with endless materials in creative mode without combat interruptions.  Then copy your building using the build toolbar, outline the area and click the toolbar save button.  Retrieve the building the building list and similar to how the ISO and craft system lists components needed and if you have them, you can 1 click the building from then on.  This is especially useful for setting up multi level turret platforms while hunting, or intricate buildings.   Even more so if you play different modes as it saves lots of time.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								In the story mode of this game you must find and bring a whole ship load of colonists together after crash-landing on an Bezier alien world filled with big stompy creatures and hostile natives. In your quest to establish a colony on this harsh, unforgiving and yet somehow still impossibly beautiful world you can build your own swords, guns, lazers, tanks, bikes helicopters boats and more to aid you in your quest. That should be enough to convince anyone to buy this game. The game is still in early access but I think the devs are going to pull it off and into a successful release as there are regular and good updates which bring new content and fix bugs.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I went on a leg to buy this game. Steam was having a discount on it. I'm a sucker for sandbox games and this ticks many of my desires in a game. I love being able to build anything I want, how I want it. It's great. There is a minor learning curve, but still easily learned. Haven't stumbled upon many glitches, just a few small ones. The ability to fly and glide is great. Building is superb. You really can get into details. My problems currently are no door locks, anyone can destroy your building in build mode by removing, and the black floor while mining. This game has a lot of potential, I hope player base picks up and the Devs keep it up.AS is 8.5/10.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a pretty cool game so far, but it still needs some polish.  I've played for a couple of hours and I'm enjoying the graphics, music and the art direction.  The controls take a bit to get used to, but I'm adapting to them.   My biggest joy so far is the exploration aspect of the game.  It's a gorgeous landscape and you really feel like you're on some alien world.  I've also been able to pick up the crafting features pretty quick and I haven't had any trouble finding resources.  It's very straight-forward if you've played any RPG or survival game in the past.  My biggest complaint is the night.  The flashlight is crappy and you don't have a good handle on how it's aimed.  My advice is to hunker down at night and craft for a while -- literally wait it out until morning.  I stumbled acrossed some nasty critters and could see what I was doing or what was attacking me.  And the combat is pretty meh.  I've just set up some turrets and I'm about to craft some guns.  I feel that these will serve me better than hand-to-hand combat.  Overall, it's a good game for the price and I look forward to building better equipment to protect me and my team from the locals.  I look forward to seeing the finished game, but a note to the developers:  MAKE THE FLASHLIGHT BETTER!  Thanks!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								The good:-Satisfying exploraton (especially in story mode)-Incredibly deep creation system (relatively simple too)-The world feels alive and there's plenty to do-Looks good and runs fairly well on my turdtop-Awesome devsThe bad: -Digging is downright clunkly-Adventure and multiplayer are buggy to the point of unplayability (Early Access though so this'll probably change)-Combat is a little simplistic (A0.9  is supposed to revamp it though, so there's that)-Learning curve is a bit steep with a barebones turorialThe probelms I have with this game are generally things that the devs have already said will change. I personally adore this game and I can't recommend it enough. As it stands the story is unfinished but loads of fun to play anyway and the feeling of venturing into the unknown and discovery is something that I so rarely get in games. Back that up with the complex item and building creation and this game already stands on its own two legs.

Early Access Review
								I've tested a few of these "Minecraft 2.0 wannabes" (as I call the genre) and by far Planet Explorers is the best, in my opinion.While it is true that the game has gone quite long without updates before (yes, a whole year) the devs have explained what happened (tl;dr version: they had to recover from outsource-induced damage), but they are now on top of things once more and updates are coming in regularly again.It is also still true that some glitches might need you to restart your game (usually in story mode) but that's mostly because the patches that fix those issues can't fix them retro-actively. Having a savegame from before you encountered the problem is usually sufficient to prevent this from happening.Multiplayer also leaves much to be desired but the devs are working on that.Remember: this game is still in pre-release, you're bound to run into some bugs.

content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								   If the amount of time i spent playing this game from the moment i  installed it is any indication, i'd give this game even in it's current alpha state 5 stars.   The combination of Minecraft style crafting system with an RPSesque story mode to give the rest of it some kind of point creates an experience that makes you actually CARE about delving into the depths for that last chunk of iron or coal. the addition of an integrated creation system that allows you to make anything from a stool to a house to a racetrack and a vehicle to race on it in multiplayer, as well as weapons and almost anything else you can imagine while still being constrained by the resources and items you've gathered in-game makes for an incredibly immersive world experience.   i got sucked in and played 33 hours the first two days i had this game. i am almost dreading the final release as the alphas scope only encompasses a small portion of the world so far an approximate 40km square area that i have as yet not found the end of.   support this game, get the alpha!
