content:
Posted: April 6
												Hours on record at the time of reviewing - 172.5Planet Explorers has been a ton of fun, and I have racked up 120 nerd hours since picking it up after full realease. Consistent, addictive, great map design with Maria (Main Story map). You can appreciate the detail and thought that went into making the VIP Colonists roles (Botanists, geologists, zoologists, bacteriologists, miners, security) Keeping in mind what sort of new or unknown viruses may be present in the that new planet. Seems to me pretty up to par when a real planetary colonization effort would take place in a distant future. Good variety of ISO's, the freedom to craft whenever and wherever you want and with a good and steady growing community uploading their creations if crafting is not your thing and rather spend more time playing, building and progressing.There is enough content, gameplay hours and sandboxing in Story Mode to make up for the flaws that that need some correcting in Adventure Mode, which are the following:• Adventure mode still feels bland, lacking content and not up to par with what is found in Story Mode, not really delivering those same dramatic landscapes and backdrops. Feels like it could be delivering a lot more, the randomly generated maps have a lot of imperfections (Terrain leveling, roads that go into the water, high-level monster spawnings where you're just starting out. • The Dungeons in Adventure Mode feel bland, linear, lacking some polishing, same layouts often found, the monsters in there are just the same wildlife found anywhere else on the map and not even following a theme of which biomes each are found, but rather mixed in together. On a more positive side, there are things found in adventure mode that would like to see in the other modes:• The unique building models that would save us some time when builing a colony and placing the already built structures to house colonists and shops for vendors. • The road network between colonies/towns.Overall I'm looking forward to the remaining gameplay I got, taking my sweet time with progressing the story, while building and exploring along the way. I feel like my initial investment back when the game was in early alpha was a good investment in the hopes of having a good finished product delivered in full-release and with updates/builds still coming in, and will most deffinitely support Pathea in further development and future DLC/Expansions for this game, I see it as a mint product that with the right new updates and content it has the potential to go far and have a long life and growing community.Thanks Pathea!

Early Access Review
								Im gonna be as fair as I can with this seeing as there 2 sidesI understand there is problems going on with the game and some people dont have the paitence or the time to deal with them I get that.Heres what i think is good:The creation system is pretty fun i enjoyed time with my friends fighting with our custom weapons and vechile i understand some people dont have that creative edge which is why the workshop is greatWide variety of animals to fight and aliens my favorite being the giant spider thing during story mode got me invested in the creation system.Buildings are ok building forts and fighting with friends was great but I agree it needs a little work.Progress seems slow on development but if you look at the changelogs the devs are working really hard it took them a long to make A.09 but within the time they made that they did all these hotfixes that were really nice.The bad and ways to make up for them:Graphics can be rathering annoying i get that and most people dont wanna turn them down and if you do they tend to look horrible what I reccomend is first making sure you have a updated flash then if its still bad custom of it using custom graphics you can make it look nice and still work for your computer you just have to work at itOre mining is see alot of complaints about this one people having a pain finding ore and then getting to it I reccomend making a cheap speedy buggy wink wink creation system and just ride around scanning for ore youll find what you need and even then what you dont just mark it then when it comes to mining navigate with the scanner best you can to stand over it your gonna need a rope gun just dig straight down dont worry the lava wont get you then mine wherver you see a weird shaped rocks and your bound to rack up a lot of ore (I reccomend going for a gold pickaxe as quick as possible so your most efficient with the ore)Final problem and one I can really really understand people hating is the random save deletion devs updates I think are causing this cause theres so many changes to the world you cant work with that file no fix to this and i hope the devs do something about it in the future.Overall I beleive its a game well worth the time best to play with friends but well worth it I enjoyed it my Friends enjoyed it. I dont care if you dont like it please just dont write a negative review with .1 hrs on the game like some people

Posted: February 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								I really liked this game in the beginning, played about 17 hrs worth.  Decided to reinstall recently and see how it is coming along,  but after recent patches the game has become frustrating to play for two reasons:Keybinds- Certain keys can no longer be changed, this is a big issue as I use EDSF instead of WSAD.  Unfortunately E is Interact and can't be changed.  Be aware you may not be able to change keybinds to what you want.Hitching- I can run the game in Fantastic setting with 60-100 fps but every minute or two I get this half a second hitch where the screen sorta freezes. My current suggestion is wait longer before getting this game.  If the dev team can correct the keybind and hitching issue I'd love to give the game a try again.  They have added a lot of really nice elements to the game, I just find it unplayable in the current state.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Have you ever used heroin? It's like a trip into an alternate universe where you don't have to think about how badly you've ♥♥♥♥ed up your life, or how badly ♥♥♥♥ed up you are against your will. I've spent a lot of time doing a lot of drugs, and everyone I know always wonders why I'm not as outwardly happy or outgoing as I was back then. I don't have the heart to tell them that by quitting the drugs that were killing me, I no longer have any desire to talk to them or spend time with them. Sometimes I do genuinely enjoy the company of others, but it is generally while highly inebriated and then in the morning my anxiety comes back tenfold, and i struggle to make it home before the panic attacks start. Maybe one day a game like this could be fully fleshed or interesting enough to hold my interest for more than a few minutes. Maybe i'm describing Second Life, and that game was an absolute catastrophe. Maybe it's the other way around, and life would be better if i could stray too far from home and be devoured by a gigantic terrifying monster. I would feed this creature, and it would live longer, and I would have been given a form of purpose, for at least some time.

								I played this game a lot. And still i don`t know if it is good or not. It has a potential. If you buy this you will enjoy a big world, custom equipment and ships and lot of other stuff. The main issue are udpates. Very rare and you need to wait long... They are big though. Second thing which made me really nervous is DIGGING. Yup. I have shovel.... wooden, stone, iron, steel etc... And still. Digging is pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ When you want to build underground tunnel network, better give up. I tried, lost almost six hours and what? You cannot place rail pivot, obstacle. (there was none, maybe some pixel big crunch... Minor error. Still so annoying...)Second thing is fuel. To maintain your base you need coal, to generators. Nothing else because it won`t work... (Still we can have small solar panel to charge batteries AND we have petrol... Maybe some gas deposists could be added or uranium...) Neverthless...Warning for potetntial buyers!- Wait to see how the updates flow, when they speed up then... Buy on your own risk. - When you don`t like the risk... Buy similar game: Space Engineers. - For now THIS game is storaged in my library... Wiaitng for some major update.

content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								2/9/15I'm kinda tired so stick with me. This game needs some time, like alot of time. Sure, the graphics and in game features are really cool, but if they're not properly setup the whole thing is nothing but a pretty turd. im running a quad core i7-3820 @3.60GHz with an AMD Radeon HD 7880 and totally updated drivers and this game is barely playable. Heres my problem.The map loads in chunks kinda like minecraft as you progress through the map but as they load i come to a screeching halt of like 5 fps. Lowering the settings to rock bottom seems to help but who wants to play a game like that? especially if your STILL having issues on the lowest settings. After spending some time on the forums it became pretty clear that certain graphics cards(like mine) struggle to render. I also saw alot of people having issues with the opencl compatability. Oh yeah, heres some pro's and con'sPro's-Gorgeus graphics.-Dense flora/fauna that actually feels like an alien planet.-Very cool crafting system.-Supportive community/devs.Con's-Lots of compatability issues for alot of people.-no sense of impact when in combat so you cant tell if you landed a hit.-UI is a ♥♥♥♥in nightmare.-balancing issues, like aggro distance.So bottom line is, research the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of this game to make sure you can run it. $25 man, $25.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20
												I know it says that I haven't played the game much, but I don't think I need to play it any longer than I have. I don't plan on it.I'm just going to start by saying that I knew that this game was in early access a while ago. I hadn't heard that it released back in November, Earlier today I was playing it, and I was thinking to myself, "I wonder when they plan on releasing this." I thought this because this game should never have been released. It's so clearly unfinished.PROS:A fairly nice atmosphere. The game looks pretty good, and the planet itself seems to be well thought out. The environments are consistent and look alright. The biomes are nice, too. Lots of variety.Many NPCs to talk to and trade with. There's a few quests in the 'story' mode, but they seem like placeholders that are still holding a place that will never be filled.The crafting/building system is pretty good, honestly. It's very creative and works well. The building system is also pretty good.There's plenty of exploration to do, as the map is fairly large. It's fun experiencing an alien planet for yourself and seeing how the developers interpreted a completely unfamiliar situation like that.Gonna be honest here, I can't think of anything else that's good. Moving on.CONS:The sound design in this game is horrendous. It seems like all of the voice acting was done in one take, and all of the music is either incredibly repetitive or just unoriginal. I ended up turning it off because it was mindless noise that was slowly driving me crazy.All of the textures look like the artists' first attempts at creating them. Most are low resolution placeholders still, and are just unappealing to look at.The animations for both your character, other NPCs, and the animals (except for the birds, weirdly enough) are incredibly ugly. They don't move naturally and are clearly either unfinished or placeholders, or they weren't cared enough about to finish.The voice acting for the NPCs that you can talk to is mostly atrocious. Sometimes it's missing entirely, sometimes it doesn't line up with what's on screen at all (the NPC will say something completely different or leave out lines entirely). The dialogue system is god awful. Your character is either as stupid as whoever decided to release this game early, or they're a sarcastic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. There is no inbetween. You don't have an option, either; it's pretty common to get two choices when talking to an NPC: [sarcastic or stupid comment] or ["No, I'm busy now"]The quest system is completely broken. I can't get it to work half of the time. Most of the time, your questlog is empty entirely. You have to speak to NPCs for them, and while this isn't an issue, it's not immediately obvious who you have to talk to. At one point, the quest system stopped giving me story quests. I talked to the guy who was *supposed* to give me the next one and he didn't have any dialogue options. At that point, I gave up and decided to climb the tallest mountain I could find. It was here that I experienced the joys of the animal pathfinding in Planet Explorers.If a hostile animal sees you, they will NEVER give up trying to get to you unless they are physically incapable (like falling in a river, or dying). Flying enemy spots you? Give up hope for trying to lose it unless you can kill it, because the stupid thing will follow you to the ends of the earth (maria, i guess) trying to kill you. The same goes for land animals; they have a stupidly long detection range, and the moment you enter it, they beeline straight for you.I bought this game for $25, and it was not worth that amount, at all. If you can get this game for less than $10, or even $5, then I'd say it'd be worth a few hours if you're bored. Otherwise, don't bother. The developers are clearly done with it other than the occasional bug fix update or tiny addition.

content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								the devs are aciively working on it, and it is a fine game, with a singleplayer and everything, check out my screenshots. it has a great mechanical physics engine other games don't, you can literaly DESIGN moving machines. that fly , drive, boat etc.. it's fairly insane on the crafting department if you go in depth. That being said patch 81a broke the game for my rig, but i'm building a new rig this week, so i look forward to it. if you want to play ABOVE low graphics get 970/r9-290x + and a good i5, or a 8600+AMD because this is a MONSTER on voxels. it doesn't just map the viewed terrain it maps entire cave systems, under ground water ways, a world of actively tracked monsters. When you can play it on MAX it's gorgeous. the devs are active and they are dedicated, but instead of putting out ♥♥♥♥♥♥ patches every 2 days, they complete entire segments of the games function per alpha patch, this sometimes leads to patches being a month+ apart, but the changes are usualy MASSIVE fixes and content. I HATE minecraft, I hate ARK, i hate all those kinds of games, especialy when they shove MP down your throat. Planet Explorers is genuinely a masterpice being made, it's just rough right now, and still alpha. no other survival explorer world game has gone as in depth or included a REAL storyline with NPC deviations and freedom. it's literaly a planet sized planet to explore. When completed the growth for content in the SP campaign will be mammoth, as well as the servers and custom worlds people run now. I've owned this game nearly a year, don't expect it to be done soon. But when it is done, expect it to be awe inspiring

Have you ever wanted to jus run and run and runandrunandrun for the first 3+ hours of a game?Do you enjoy the lack of satisfaction upon completing a mission?Do you enjoy complex controls?Do you enjoy feeling stupid as the games controls defeat you again and again?Do you enjoy researching games on youtube for hours just to figure out how things work?Do you have alot of free time?Then my friend your in luck, today and today only, this game, one of wonder can be YOURS!For jus the low price of whatever STEAM is selling it for you can OWN your very own, digital copy of Planet Explorers.LIES!! NO!! no lies here folks. Have you ever wanted to play a game that reminded you of the frustraion you had as a young gamer. When you would throw your remote and break it, or even break the console itself!Those days can be your again my friend.  For the low price of just $__.__(<~~~put your price here) You can own a game youll instantly regret getting for the rest of your life!!!No but seriously, i kno the game is still alpha and it IS a dope game, ANY GAME where u can build cars n helicopters. (like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts????) yes like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts. is dope, however i did find myself getting jus so angry with this game, which is funny cuz im so not an angry guy lol. the last time i got mad at a GAME i was like 9 haha. i would reccomend the game, even if it pisses you off youll still enjoy it. i just hate the way it feels like warcraft, like jus way too open n i dunno boring? like spore? the terrain for me is like that. oh whats that? theres monsters raiding the camp? BUT on a lighter note, buy it, so im not the only one stuck in hell. i need help. and a friend.BTW, let my wife play this last night, and yea....nothing like your significant other showing you up on a video game, the whole time im jus like, WHY IS THIS HAPPENING, basically the game played smoothly for her. she was able to actually have events trigger, which did not happen on my save....Women.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												The pricetag may seem a little steep but don't be surprised if you find yourself putting 100 hours into this.It feels a lot like Minecraft but it improves in a lot of areas where Minecraft falls short.Similarities: -Voxel based building-Crafting-Pre-generated monsters (not randomly generated)-Swords/Axes/Pickaxes on your 1-2-3~9 slots, like you'd expect-Healing items/food/drinkDifferences:-World is not randomly generated (I've only played Story so far) -Build a community and bring all of the humans together to help your cause (even in multiplayer)-Non-Voxel based digging -MEAT IS MONEY (for a good while anyways) -Aggressive NPC villages -VOXEL BASED ITEM/OBJECT BUILDING: Make your weapon look like whatever you build it to look like. -VOXEL BASED VEHICLE BUILDING: Build a Car/Helicopter/Submarine/Weird Jumping spinning orb thing/ chair on a propeller/ rocket seat/ anything you can make moveProblems:-Light does not get stopped by the dirt you dig, making it bright in the day, and dark in the night, underground, regardless of how far you go. Underground bases are very easy to make though.-Combat is really clunky, and shooting is not very user friendly. [TAP left click to enter aiming mode, then left click to fire, tap right click to put your gun down.] {Suggestion to change it to HOLD right click to aim please!}-Weapons have really deliberate animations that move your character in an unusual manner and the slash isn't quite the spot you'd expect it to go. But there are Daggers/2H/ and 1H/Shield styles now, so that fixes it a bit. -NPC pathing is non-existant and functions on a teleportation system-That damn poo quest lolMULTIPLAYER SPECIFIC:-Randomly generated-Contains randomly generated dungeons that are pretty funCons: You can delete voxels that other people placed, even within their own colony. You can also steal their Sentries and prefabs. It even gives you the materials. This is a Pro if you're a troll. :PSteam has a REFUND SYSTEM! Give this game an hour's worth of your time and if you don't like it, simply refund it. I encourage anybody who loves Minecraft (especially if you modded it a lot) to try this game.Nominated in the "other" category with the reason "Hidden Gem"

content:
Posted: March 17
												This game has unexpextedly been alot of fun. I originally did not have much hopes for this title after my first experience. (about 1 year ago) since the new updates the game has much more to offer. Likes:*Craft anything without haveing hours of farming due to the ingame currency system with the npc's IE if you dont want to go collect coal, kill monsters then trade the hide for currency! and buy what you need.*True terra form in a easy to use system that makes sense!*Great voice acting for all major npc quests!*A rather large world to explore*Build anywhere! *Easy to understand UI and hot bar*Really compelling story mode that keeps you going.Cons*Graphics are not the best*Development seems slow (however they are updating again!)*Random clipping issues (no as bad as Subnautica though!) LOLOverallGood game with tons of potential, have spent alot of my time recently enjoying this game. ps the riding system for the aliens makes sense, good work Devs, for a crew with a limited budjet its a great overall game.

That being said patch 81a broke the game for my rig, but i'm building a new rig this week, so i look forward to it. if you want to play ABOVE low graphics get 970/r9-290x + and a good i5, or a 8600+AMD because this is a MONSTER on voxels. it doesn't just map the viewed terrain it maps entire cave systems, under ground water ways, a world of actively tracked monsters. When you can play it on MAX it's gorgeous. the devs are active and they are dedicated, but instead of putting out ♥♥♥♥♥♥ patches every 2 days, they complete entire segments of the games function per alpha patch, this sometimes leads to patches being a month+ apart, but the changes are usualy MASSIVE fixes and content. I HATE minecraft, I hate ARK, i hate all those kinds of games, especialy when they shove MP down your throat. Planet Explorers is genuinely a masterpice being made, it's just rough right now, and still alpha. no other survival explorer world game has gone as in depth or included a REAL storyline with NPC deviations and freedom. it's literaly a planet sized planet to explore. When completed the growth for content in the SP campaign will be mammoth, as well as the servers and custom worlds people run now. I've owned this game nearly a year, don't expect it to be done soon. But when it is done, expect it to be awe inspiring

content:
Posted: February 6
												To recommend this Game was not an easy decision for me. Like many others, i bought the Game long ago in alpha, looking forward to Release. To tell the truth, I'm still not sure, if recommending is right oder not. Sure, it made many prpgress since my first playthrough, Bugs were solved, Content was added, Graphics got better, Stability went up.On the other side, like many others said here, it's still not polished enough and it lacks still Content, Missions and Freedom. I think, for a Steam Sale it's worth the price, because there's still potential and devs work on it. Many here forget, that the devs are not a Big Studio, Minecraft, Empyrion are concurrent and other Sandbox Survival Games are popping up every day. I still trust the devs, because over the years, if you read their postings and threads, i have the impression, it's their baby and they will finish it some day. Only because of the history of the development i decided to recommend it, but BE WARNED!!! It's finished like a GAme with a Deadline!!! You can play it, you can have fun, but it still feels a little unfinished and unpolished sometimes.

Early Access Review
								Do you like running for hours? Have you ever wanted to jus run and run and runandrunandrun for the first 3+ hours of a game?Do you enjoy the lack of satisfaction upon completing a mission?Do you enjoy complex controls?Do you enjoy feeling stupid as the games controls defeat you again and again?Do you enjoy researching games on youtube for hours just to figure out how things work?Do you have alot of free time?Then my friend your in luck, today and today only, this game, one of wonder can be YOURS!For jus the low price of whatever STEAM is selling it for you can OWN your very own, digital copy of Planet Explorers.LIES!! NO!! no lies here folks. Have you ever wanted to play a game that reminded you of the frustraion you had as a young gamer. When you would throw your remote and break it, or even break the console itself!Those days can be your again my friend.  For the low price of just $__.__(<~~~put your price here) You can own a game youll instantly regret getting for the rest of your life!!!No but seriously, i kno the game is still alpha and it IS a dope game, ANY GAME where u can build cars n helicopters. (like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts????) yes like banjo kazooie nuts and bolts. is dope, however i did find myself getting jus so angry with this game, which is funny cuz im so not an angry guy lol. the last time i got mad at a GAME i was like 9 haha. i would reccomend the game, even if it pisses you off youll still enjoy it. i just hate the way it feels like warcraft, like jus way too open n i dunno boring? like spore? the terrain for me is like that. oh whats that? theres monsters raiding the camp? (looks around) not a single monster. Start running.and im all about travelling within reason, but if i start the game, and have to auto run for 20mins in the first 10 15 mins of gameplay....yea that so totally destroys my hard on for this game. BUT on a lighter note, buy it, so im not the only one stuck in hell. i need help. and a friend.BTW, let my wife play this last night, and yea....nothing like your significant other showing you up on a video game, the whole time im jus like, WHY IS THIS HAPPENING, basically the game played smoothly for her. she was able to actually have events trigger, which did not happen on my save....Women.

content:
Posted: March 17
												This game has unexpextedly been alot of fun. I originally did not have much hopes for this title after my first experience. (about 1 year ago) since the new updates the game has much more to offer. Likes:*Craft anything without haveing hours of farming due to the ingame currency system with the npc's IE if you dont want to go collect coal, kill monsters then trade the hide for currency! and buy what you need.*True terra form in a easy to use system that makes sense!*Great voice acting for all major npc quests!*A rather large world to explore*Build anywhere! *Easy to understand UI and hot bar*Really compelling story mode that keeps you going.Cons*Graphics are not the best*Development seems slow (however they are updating again!)*Random clipping issues (no as bad as Subnautica though!) LOLOverallGood game with tons of potential, have spent alot of my time recently enjoying this game. ps the riding system for the aliens makes sense, good work Devs, for a crew with a limited budjet its a great overall game.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												The pricetag may seem a little steep but don't be surprised if you find yourself putting 100 hours into this.It feels a lot like Minecraft but it improves in a lot of areas where Minecraft falls short.Similarities: -Voxel based building-Crafting-Pre-generated monsters (not randomly generated)-Swords/Axes/Pickaxes on your 1-2-3~9 slots, like you'd expect-Healing items/food/drinkDifferences:-World is not randomly generated (I've only played Story so far) -Build a community and bring all of the humans together to help your cause (even in multiplayer)-Non-Voxel based digging -MEAT IS MONEY (for a good while anyways) -Aggressive NPC villages -VOXEL BASED ITEM/OBJECT BUILDING: Make your weapon look like whatever you build it to look like. -VOXEL BASED VEHICLE BUILDING: Build a Car/Helicopter/Submarine/Weird Jumping spinning orb thing/ chair on a propeller/ rocket seat/ anything you can make moveProblems:-Light does not get stopped by the dirt you dig, making it bright in the day, and dark in the night, underground, regardless of how far you go. Underground bases are very easy to make though.-Combat is really clunky, and shooting is not very user friendly. [TAP left click to enter aiming mode, then left click to fire, tap right click to put your gun down.] {Suggestion to change it to HOLD right click to aim please!}-Weapons have really deliberate animations that move your character in an unusual manner and the slash isn't quite the spot you'd expect it to go. But there are Daggers/2H/ and 1H/Shield styles now, so that fixes it a bit. -NPC pathing is non-existant and functions on a teleportation system-That damn poo quest lolMULTIPLAYER SPECIFIC:-Randomly generated-Contains randomly generated dungeons that are pretty funCons: You can delete voxels that other people placed, even within their own colony. You can also steal their Sentries and prefabs. It even gives you the materials. This is a Pro if you're a troll. :PSteam has a REFUND SYSTEM! Give this game an hour's worth of your time and if you don't like it, simply refund it. I encourage anybody who loves Minecraft (especially if you modded it a lot) to try this game.Nominated in the "other" category with the reason "Hidden Gem"

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								i found this game extremely dull. for one point, there is no "exploring" you walk in a plane for 30 minutes and see the same stuff over and over again. not only that but when you get killed by an aggressive creature, you have to wait about 2 minutes for it to walk away and leave you alone, otherwise you would be killed by the same thing six times in a row. i havent found any landmarks, or any special locations, and i walked for quite a while. i more recently started in a spawn location surrounded by unclimbable mountains. onto the price, i spent $15 on this game and i was disappointed, if i had played some sort of demo before i bought it, i would not have even thought of purchasing this game, even for $10.    either way, bad game or not, it is a pretty one. this game has a wide variety of creatures, many of which i havent seen. and the foliage is quite pretty too. there are many harvestable plants, which are used for crafting and trading.    the quests in the story are very annoying.in conclusion, i despise of this game, i think it is overpriced and repetetive, the quests compare to a free MMO, back and forth, kill ten of this collect four of these, craft a torch that takes you forever to find animals for. i think this game is bad. i understand it is in early access, but these are things that are at the core of the game, not things like glitches. i want my $15 back. and i would rather play everquest. i did not enjoy this game at all, i tried to like it, honestly, but all i saw was a mmo.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a great game, for any who like minecraft, terraria or other games like that, this is a great pick. Multiplayer and adventure mode are pretty empty and bland but its only in an early stage of development so thats to be expected, the story mode, however, while nothing to special is still great but mostly consists of petty fetch quests but i doubt theyll stay like that.but were the game stands out the most is the deep building system. Teraforming is a bit buggy still and buildings are simple to make with the deep build mode system. its not that different from minecraft but instead just a retexture of different tools for different materials you can design your own. its a simple to learn but complex to master system that really works well right now with few bugs (that ive encountered). plus it has much content and more frequent updates than Starforge.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								So far, I'm quite pleased with the state this is in, in Alpha. I was an avid Minecraft player though less on the "elaborate builds" and more on the "exploration and live in a hollowed out cave" side, so initially this is pretty good for indulging your Exploratory side, and building looks customizable enough that it'll be a decent-sized learning curve vs simple blocks/pixel recreation; ergo, it'll be more in-depth and nice looking than Blocky builds would, but also harder to tweak just right than simply slapping one block/lego onto another in some cases.It is an Alpha though at the time of this review, so there's some minor bugs/issues; movement can be wonky sometimes(it was worse, but they actually made it better in a recent update), I had a quest to escort an npc to a place and had to kill 3 monsters at the location, but they spawned underground or something and, while still being marked on my map, weren't killable, breaking the quest. The NPC went ahead and acted like I'd beaten them, but since I hadn't, couldn't complete. This was in Story Mode, though, and will likely be fixed at the rate they work.Server-based Multiplayer is available, though still finicky in it's current iteration. I tried to create a game with a friend and it simply wasn't showing up in the list, and vice versa. I assume/hope that they'll be working on that and making hosting & joining a little easier for the average joe to do without having to learn to set up "actual" servers for small-numbers co-op play with a friend or two.TL;DR: If you like Survival/Exploration/Building games a la Minecraft, Terraria, or even similar to Everquest Landmark, with a solid single player experience as well as Multiplayer options, this is worth a shot for ya. I'm eager to see where it goes as it progresses into a more stable Beta and eventual Launch.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pardon my grammar. I am writing this because i am sick of being "early access pwnt" where a game looks cool, but it is not worth it, and the devs post positive reviews to sell it. Best crafting  I have ever played. unlike a lot of crafting games which feels like "farm farm farm farm...... FINALLY I MADE SOMETHING!!!.... Farm farm farm farm" the crafting in planet explorers is extremely addictive. It is not (combine to make item) it's more like literally building a vehicle or weapon from scratch. Go look at the items in the workshop that people have made, then I want anyone who reads this to know that EVERYTHING was made in game. It is not programming, its created in game with a very user friendly system. There currently is enough for 50+ hours of fun, even more playing multiplayer.Pros.Devs update like no other early access I have played yet (this is not a starbound)crafting system is 10/10 I spent about half time in game creating. great feeling of adventuregood amount of enemies/materials/biom/random featuresstats are based on what materials are used on the item/vehical    -for example a sword made of diamond will be sharper than metal, but break easier. it will do more dmg but you will have to repair it sooner. Also you need to create a sharp edge in order to get max dmg. the crafting actually bases the stats based on literal qualites. lengthening/shortending gun barels changes how it shoots. vehicals made from aluminum will fly way faster than gold because it is lighter. multiple game modesPotential for one of the most monumental sandbox games ever when it is released.Consmultiplayer is difficult to get working and saved for someone that is not used to port fowardingmonsters seem too easy. the replayability currently is more about creating more than progressing/killing harder bosses no dungeons (personal con)fighting style is slightly clunky, however in the time I have owned the game it has gotten a ton better. still at times not smoothnot enough action as I would like in a sandbox. I realize that is asking a lot, but even tho they have a lot of different monsters in this world, it gets old running around killing everything. Later on in the game, you kill everything VERY easilly.For the crafting I recomend this game, if you absolutly love sandbox crafting games buy it, for everyone else wait until they impliment more.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												Planet Explorers is a great mix of RPG, Survival with Crafting comprehensive and complex.If you are looking for a Survival different from others with RPG elements is that with rewarding crafting, surely this is the game for you.The game features three interesting mode and in more you also have the chance to play in single player and/or multiplayer Versus or Co-Op servers.Definitely not a masterpiece and some games in Early Access perhaps offer the same content, but i can guarantee that at this Christmas price (or discount) definitely worth it.Advised and Recommended for fans of the genre, especially if you like complete and complex crafting.You can literally create weapons, vehicles, armors and more from scratch and how you want (in accordance with certain limits)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25
												It's a good game, and it has a good story and tons to do. I am a bit let down by the colony system however. I feel it was presented as an automated system- once you got it up and running, the people you gather for your colony kinda of automate. I expected them to start building furniture (not placing it) and wall materials and weapons and guns, but they build really odd things and only a little bit. The systems aren't very well designed from a UI interface point either, requiring you to choose to craft from your personal inventory or the colony, keeping a split inventory, which I dislike.It is still worth the cost and a good game. I just wish the colonies worked a touch different.

XD....enemies that fill the screen...     there are some issues od course and since this and early axxes im still hoping for a few additions .. like venturing to other planets.. more stuff to build only tho i think i've only scratched the surface of what the game has to offer.. havent even made my first vehicle yet...better character creator.... character progression.. other than new gear.. skills or someething like that... more suggestions later. xD. get the game. this could be hhhuge.. support this game...

number of helpful: 25 of 53 people (47%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I honestly have no idea why this game gets such great reviews. It's an Early Access game, but the last time I saw it was a year ago. To say it's improved would be a gross overstatement.First off, optimization sucks. I have a rig that can run most AAA games with ease on full. I've tried all of the rendering options, and no matter what I do, the game absolutely slows to a 10 fps crawl even when I'm the only living thing on a small, barren island. It's not like the game looks good or anything, it's pretty basic.The world generation is terrible and very frequently I've seen trees and boulders sticking out of the sides of islands. Along with that I've fallen out of the game world twice in 20 minutes.The UI is clunky and the controls are terrible. It gives you the illusion of having two control schemes only for one to just flat out not work and you're forced to work with its default awful WoW-type interface that tries to be both an MMO and Minecraft, but is bad at both. The animations are buggy and I've frequently been moonwalking underwater. Chatting with other players is difficult and a huge pain. Some hotkeys, like holstering your item, just flat out don't work. Also, the HUD is useless in informing you if you've taken any damage or are undergoing any effects.Honestly, I haven't gotten far into the game, only an hour or so with half in SP and half in MP, but I feel like I've played all I need to know that this game's not worth it, at least not right now.Say all you want about how it's an Early Access game, but the truth of the matter is, at the time of this writing, from what I've played, this game barely passes as an alpha. It's riddled with bugs, is unpolished as hell, and has quality worse than most free games out there. I came in expecting a 3D Starbound sandbox and got just another stagnant, buggy as hell Early Access game. Don't buy it.

number of helpful: 22 of 47 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								In it's current Alpha state, I would not recommend this game... yet. It still needs a lot of work. My biggest peeve when playing was the length of time it took to do... anything. The day/night cycle is too long (one minute is about 5 seconds), the movement of the character is slow (even running), and the controls are clunky and poorly executed. I think this game has great potential, but it still needs a lot of work. The crafting of ISO's and buildings is an excellent idea, I just wish it was simpler to use. Also there is not much help from the game. No tips on what to do during a quest, no journal or log to keep track of plants/wildlife/materials/etc, definitely not much help when crafting. Another thing that really bothered me was knowing what I could and couldn't interact with and selecting those certain things. it took way too long for me to figure out what plants I could harvest and to even harvest them. It felt like no position or amount of clicking around said plant would help me harvest it. acquiring resources is a real drag. I'm stuck on a quest from an AI in the game that requires me to find 30 pieces of copper and 5 pieces of tin. It's freaking impossible to mine quickly and there's no distinction between minerals in the terrain. I've  acquired all kinds of minerals from terrain that looks the same. Which brings me to the world itself... it's pretty boring. The first mission in the story requires you to escort two companions to a camp, but nothing attacks you or delays you. you just run there.... talk about anti-climactic! Anyway, the world itself needs more life. The graphics are okay. The lighting and shadowing is well done, some of the plants look fine, but the grass.... it's literally everywhere and it looks bad. Well that's about it for the negative stuff. There are positives to this game though. It has potential to be great and I know once the delevopers consider our feedback as a community this game will be polished pretty nicely. Until then, I would say buy at your own risk.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Aside from the expected Early Access wonkiness Planet Explorers unfortunately runs into the same trap a lot of similar 'Minecraft BUT MORE' games fall into, which is to ditch the intuitive Lego-ish building in favor of something more akin to a  3D modeling suite. I wish it all the best because it's so exciting on a conceptual level but unless the game part of the finished product ends up wildly compelling (right now it's like a wonky and lonely MMO) it's just really hard to recommend spending your time learning how to build stuff in this over doing the same in Blender or UDK (both of which are free to mess with) and picking up some useful skills along the way.

number of helpful: 130 of 269 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Quick Review as of 0.75 Alpha. If it's a game being sold, it's a game i'm going to review.--Pros:Large Open WorldSandbox gameCraftingAlien AnimalsNice water--Cons / needs to be improved:Clunky Controls.No first person view *** CORECTION** THERE IS FIRST PERSON. World has no atmosphere, as in no life, nothing happening.Poor textures. Poor graphics. (Too much bloom, strange grass that constantly waves, no FOV slider)Poor animationsPoor combatPoor UI, especially when building ISOs. Feels like I need a degree in graphic design to use it.No collision on certain objects, able to walk through them.No tutorial, or help guidePoor character customisation. Poor AILimited DialogueStarting from the top this game features an open world larger than 7 days to die if I judge at a glance. It has grass lands, deserts and forests. Crafting is also included in the game which uses a similar system to starbound if i recall correctly, similar UI as well, nothing much to say apart from it appears to work as expected if you have played starbound or terraria.The controls are poor in my opinion. As you first start the game it requires you to hold the right mouse button and drag to move the camera. Or you can press F2 and have it follow your character as you would expect from a game post year 2005. The problem with this is the UI becomes difficult and you can't interact with anything unless you press and hold tab. So for you to talk to a character I have to hold tab, then right click on the character. If I let go of tab I can't click the dialog options. As you are walking around the world, apart from alien animals wandering around aimlessly the world is empty. It's hard to explain however minecraft also suffered the same problem. No birds or atmospheric sound effects. Nothing really happening in the atmosphere. The textures are poor. They look like they have just stepped out of 2006. There is too much bloom, the grass is horrible and I know they are trying to go for an alien look but it really grinds against my gears. All of the grass waves in front of you for no apparent reason, there is no logic. Apart from the textures at least the colours are good!The animations are fairly bad. You jump 3 metres high, and there is no life in your character it's like moving a robot. This is especially apparent when in combat. I think the character only makes 2-3 animations in the whole combat. You also get a shield which I couldn't work out how to use as it's stuck inside his arm and is smaller than a compact disc.The UI is poor. The ISO designer which lets you build weapons or design vehicles appears at first view like you need a degree in graphic design software. After about 20 mins you start to get the hang of it but personally I gave up because I'm playing a game to have fun, not to make me feel like a designer at work. The UI on 1920x1080 appears very small. I had to put on my reading glasses to see anything. Also The whole layout feels clunky, when talking to people I don't like how you click on the words and how they are 3pt small.The character customisation needs work. Nothing to choose from and the pre-set faces are terrible. You need to add the option to design your own face like sims, as the pre-set faces are the most ugliest I’ve seen to date.The AI is Poor. They walk around turning on their back heel like Michael Jackson, or staring at walls. I was attacked in the starting camp and everyone let me get my♥♥♥♥♥kicked, thanks AI  !At this stage it's absolutely not worth £18.99. For some reason I see people talking it up like it's the best thing since slice bread and WHY?! I am not going to try and pretend it's good so I feel like I got my money’s worth. It's not very good unless you are new to gaming.It's worth £5 on a steam sale. It's an avoid from me. First game I switched off and deleted after an hour.

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
												I picked up this game early in the EA cycle and almost immeadiately put it down after playing a couple of hours since the initial release was a steaming pile of hot garbage.So I gave it a year or two to gather some steam and put some polish, enough time to pass from alpha to beta.And its still hot garbage.Okay for the usual breakdown:Visuals:Visually Planet Explorers is pretty nice, for what it is and what cycle of development its in it accomplishes a great deal. Character customization is fine, standard fare. Building things is equally detailed and can produce some very amazing things.Sound:Likewise, gets the job done, it's not perfect but its still beta so a few bugs here and there is to be expected.Gameplay:Here is where Planet Explorers still fails.In early alpha the 'fetch' quests had you traversing great distances for the most minor of things. At that time spawners didn't care if you were a veteran or a fresh spawn, you would likely stumble into alien creatures vastly out of your league all for pidly rewards.Beta... they've cleaned it up but they've added more game modes and no documentation. When you now start up the game you can adjust your visuals and get thrown into a starter screen where you pick Story, Adventurer etc etc. NONE OF WHICH are explained. I *imagine* story is the original alpha experience, the crashed ship, the fetch quests etc and so forth so I thought I'd try adventure.The first thing to fail is the fact that you can only take one quest at a time. There's half a dozen in your starter area but you can only take ONE main quest and one side quest. The main quest has you hoofing it a huge distance to a 'settlement', have fun running half an hour back and forth between HUBs to do the other STARTER quests. That's only a guess as the original beautiful world generation is utterly borked in adventure mode. Leaving the starter village required building a set of stairs to reach the floating mountain and the road onwards. Seriously... and its not the only floating mountain, I spawned on a grassy plateau surrounded by water at the bottom of a huge cliff and half a dozen floating mountains.There's no explination of game modes, there's no tutorial to (re)familiarize yourself with how the game works. You spawn and are pretty much up to yourself to figure out how the game works.Like alpha, I played the beta for an hour then uninstalled again.Seriously, I advise all perspective buyers to wait. There's tons of potential here assuming the devs stop taking five steps backwards every time they take one forward. It's great that its optimized and looks pretty but if the functionality is abyssmal it doesn't matter how nice it looks.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am sure this game is very fun and innovative but unfortunately for me it is just way to difficult and overwhelming. To explain I tried story mode and had some fun with it for the first few quests...but then the game became WAYYY to difficult WAYYY too quickly. The sheer distance you had to travel from a doctors camp to another quest point was too long and during your travel to this point blood thirsty creatures who are way too tough kill you instantly, even with my gun they were still too difficult. Then another quest took me to some altar where 3 giant bird creatures hovered over it...I died numerous times here but thankfully the game gave you an invincible NPC to follow you with a rifle to help you...so I waited dead for the NPC to kill all 3 of them and the NPC even had trouble cause it took over 20 mins for him to kill 2 of the birds....finally I got up bought some bullets from the NPC and the bird took over 50 bullets to die!!! DXI stuck it out and played a little longer even though my frustration at this point was high from dieing so much, I came to point where a female NPC took me into the creation tool kit to make a vehicle...This creator is not user friendly at all, and the tutorial is skimpy at best. For me I could not figure out how to make a basic car without looking up a guide on youtube. To my knowledge there are no base vehicles either, so that means that you HAVE to build a vehicle otherwise your trapped on foot the entire game.This game is in development so I can't be too hard but it just seems to drop you off in this overwhelming massive world with little instruction to help you out... I am sure if I spent an hour mining materials I would have had a bit easier time since I could have probably made a better weapon, but the game should not be like that at least not so early. The game should not punish you and send you on a "chore run" to mine 100 iron just to kill 3 birds. I say if you are thinking about this game is wait til it is out of development and they address issues.

Too fast transaction to beta and will probably go way to fast to "final" version. I would recommend looking into some other game or get this when it is on sale for a few bucks/euros. It may sound harsh, but I don't think the game is worth the current price with the current pace. But maybe I'm wrong, perhaps this will be a gem in the years to come.

content:
Posted: February 28
												I bought this game in early release about a year ago but was too busy to play it until recently (late February 2017).  But I kept up with the reviews, and saw a lot of thumbs down for it.  My experience has been the great with the game, and I'm guessing that a lot of players who gave bad reviews jumped right in to story mode.  I did the opposite, I went in to build mode first because I like exploration games, and also because I wanted to see what the game could actually do.  I have played build and adventure mode, but not story mode yet.  Keep in mind this game was billed from the start as an “open world sandbox adventure RPG game,” and I love sandbox games.Build mode:This is the sandbox aspect of the game, and it's fantastic.  The worlds and scenery are utterly gorgeous, and the adventures you can have are enormous.  I jumped in to this first to see what the developers achieved, and it's really nice.  You get all the weapons, some template air/land/water vehicles, turrets, jetpacks-- if it's in the game you get access to it.  Playing this mode first helped me figure out how to use the GUI, controls, and how things worked overall so it was definitely the right move.  Besides being beautiful, it had some nice touches like the music changing with the terrain type.  It was awesome to fly around a helicopter in the desert at night with search lights and then to return to my base by finding my campfires.  I built a quad and tore up the sand, so much fun.Cons of build mode:  As feedback for the developers I would say that while the fun level of build mode is top notch, what made this great experience feel sterile is the fact that you're completely alone.  Not even a single animal.  There were animal sounds by the beach, but no animals.  Bird sounds, but no birds.  It would be a great touch to add some passive animals just for scenery, or to practice one's hunting skills.  The ability to add an NPC follower or something might be nice too, but non-threatening animals I think are a requisite to complete the beautiful picture of nature they have painted.  This solitary player presence affected the replayability of this mode since it gets boring to play around as the only living creature in these huge worlds.Adventure mode:This mode is where you essentially jump in to a map and have choose-it-yourself adventures.  It's the same beautiful scenery, and the seed-generated map I got was the stock planet Maria.  I covered about half of the map and found at least four different kinds of environments so far.  But superimposed on to this grandeur that I saw in build mode was animals, NPCs, and quests (and even dungeons), a nice old school touch that I didn't expect.  In this mode you get the RPG features, like having to gather resources and work the tech trees to advance.  I'm glad I did build mode first so I understood what to do and how things work, which made entering adventure mode even more fun for me.Cons of adventure mode:  I didn't notice too many negatives about this mode, but one that I saw was glaring.  I think there were two difficulty level choices (easy and normal) for adventure mode, so I took easy just to be safe because I wanted to explore it.  Well, some hit-point related things definitely were not easy.  For example, my NPC follower and I were crossing terrain and these two huge birds started to attack us.  A single strike from a bird resulted in the lost of 75% health, not what I would expect on an “easy” setting for sure.  The same was true for entering one dungeon, we got wiped out pretty quick by the NPCs there, so making sure that the easy setting means “go have fun in all areas” should be considered.Miscellaneous:I didn't get the crashes a lot of people reported.  I ran version 1.6 of the game, and I was on a mac mini with 8GB of ram and Intel 4000 graphics.  The game ran very well, with slight lag in the finer special effects but not enough to ruin my enjoyment of the game overall.  I did have a problem with the game consistently loading though.  It would get stuck on the company logo screen and not move on, so I'd have to keep force quitting it and keep trying.  I found a similar “mac loader” problem in the forums so I hope the developers can smooth this out.Summary:Planet explorers is a great game, and top notch exploration game in my opinion.  I logged 35 hours on it in the first 3 days of playing it was so much fun.  While it's no longer in early access, it's still a version 1.x of a very large, intricate, and ambitious game.  I supported the developers in the EA phase because I wanted to see it work, and I have done that for other games like Kerbal Space Program.  So if you expect a finished product out of the box you should stay out of all EA and 1.x release games, but if you want a great game where you can build, explore, quest, and just have fun then Planet Explorers is well worth a look.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								At the current state that the game is in, I do NOT recommend purchasing it. For starters, there is no audio that plays when you do well...anything. You'll occasionally hear ambient noises that play on repeat but you'll hear no footsteps or anything whatsoever. The audio is horrible.Second of all, the game is very...je ne sais quois. You can't really customize your character as most of the options are invisible (a glitch of course). The graphics are a mix of the PS2 era and the PS3 era - they're highly outdated which isn't a problem as this is a voxel based building game. I don't mind it.Colonists don't do anything. They literally stand there all day doing absolutely nothing but sell you goods. It feels as if the world revolves around you (which is a very bad thing for a game like this). I truly hope this game becomes that game that it wants to be because after all this, I still support the game developers. I respect what they're trying to do and I just want you to understand that this is an early access game. There are plenty of bugs and you're pretty much paying to fund the development.The building is great fun and very detailed. Combat is horrible, though. If you have any further questions, you may direct them to me by sending me a message on Steam. I will gladly answer it for you as I truly do want to like this game. I will find something I like, I swear it.

content:
Posted: March 28
Product received for free
												At first, I didn't understand the game at all. I stopped playing and thought, what a waste (I got it as a gift). But after a while I gave it a second try and saw the possibilities of this game. I am quite happy with this game now and enjoy building and playing a lot.You really need to understand this game, they have a hard time explaining how to play. Hosting your own game has some issues too, but when it works, it is ok. Sometimes a bit lag or some bugs, and the fighting system isn't very good but acceptable for me. Don't expect a 'perfect' polished game! Be warned!I recommend it if you like: 1. Building, having your own base(s) and people which gives endless possibilities. 2. Designing your own vehicles/aircraft, or use other peoples designs and like to explore.Avoid if you: 1. Haven't played similar building games, because you have a hard time learning (ARK, Minecraft)2. Get frustrated easily

Early Access Review
								I know its in early development!! It looked so promising and then... then the /strike  I mean the bugs... The bugs attacked. So after spawning in I go around the colony to mine and cut some trees down. All happy and fun right? Nope! Just after I start to have a good time a giant wind-dragon thing of destruction came and started to kill me, unequipt to fight a flying monster I run into one of the colony buildings and decide to let the "gaurd" NPCs take care of it. Nope! The little s***bird starts attacking me through the walls and the NPCs sit around with their thumb up their yaho watching me get torn apart through the walls! I die. Respawn. Decide to go fight this thing.... *20 lifes later* I finally kill it! Lets see what I get.... Congradulations an entire 10 meat! We know half your invintory dropped and despawned from being murdered by our glitchdragon so you get an entire 10 meat! 10 MEAT? WTF! I decide to keep playing reminding myself the game is in early acess. I continue to chop down trees then bam. A giant 6 legged lion cubone thing runs straight through three trees and starts to pounce on me. *15 lives later* 30 meat and 1 animal skin. Yay. . . . . So back to cutting wood. . . N O P E ! a pack of 3 lion cubones come and I just quit because I dont feel like wasting another 30 min. of my pitiful life playing this game.
